title: Schema for an Open Contracting Release
description: Each release provides data about a single contracting process at a particular point in time. Releases can be used to notify users of new tenders, awards, contracts and other updates. Releases may repeat or update information provided previously in this contracting process. One contracting process may have many releases. A 'record' of a contracting process follows the same structure as a release, but combines information from multiple points in time into a single summary.

ocid.title: Open Contracting ID
ocid.description: A globally unique identifier for this Open Contracting Process. Composed of an ocid prefix and an identifier for the contracting process. For more information see the [Open Contracting Identifier guidance](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/identifiers/)

id.title: Release ID
id.description: An identifier for this particular release of information. A release identifier must be unique within the scope of its related contracting process (defined by a common ocid). A release identifier must not contain the # character.

date.title: Release Date
date.description: The date on which the information contained in the release was first recorded in, or published by, any system.

tag.title: Release Tag
tag.description: One or more values from the closed [releaseTag](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#release-tag) codelist. Tags can be used to filter releases and to understand the kind of information that releases might contain.

initiationType.title: Initiation type
initiationType.description: String specifying the type of initiation process used for this contract, taken from the initiationType codelist. In OCDS for PPPs, only ppp is supported.

parties.title: Parties
parties.description: Information on the parties (organizations, economic operators and other participants) who are involved in the contracting process and their roles, e.g. buyer, procuring entity, supplier etc. Organization references elsewhere in the schema are used to refer back to this entries in this list.

buyer.title: Buyer
buyer.description: A buyer is an entity whose budget will be used to pay for goods, works or services related to a contract. This may be different from the procuring entity who may be specified in the tender data.

planning.title: Planning
planning.description: Information from the planning phase of the contracting process. This includes information related to the process of deciding what to contract, when and how.

tender.title: Tender
tender.description: The activities undertaken in order to enter into a contract.

awards.title: Awards
awards.description: Information from the award phase of the contracting process. There can be more than one award per contracting process e.g. because the contract is split among different providers, or because it is a standing offer.

contracts.title: Contracts
contracts.description: Information from the contract creation phase of the procurement process.

language.title: Release language
language.description: The default language of the data using either two-letter [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of lowercase two-letter codes from [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is recommended.

relatedProcesses.description: The details of related processes: for example, if this process follows on from one or more other processes, represented under a separate open contracting identifier (ocid). This is commonly used to relate mini-competitions to their parent frameworks or individual tenders to a broader planning process.
relatedProcesses.title: Related processes

bids.title: Bids
bids.description: The bid section is used to publish summary statistics, and where applicable, individual bid information.

statistics.title: Statistics
statistics.description: Summary statistics about the number of bidders, bids and expressions of interest.

details.title: Submission details
details.description: Information about individual bids and expressions of interest.

title.title: Title
title.description: A overall title for this contracting process or release.

description.title: Description
description.description: An overall description of this contracting process or release. This does not replace a detailed breakdown of the objects of the contracting process in the planning, tender, award or contracts section.

preQualification.title: Pre-qualification
preQualification.description: The activities undertaken in order to qualify suppliers to participate in the tender.

publicAuthority.title: Public authority
publicAuthority.description: The public authority is the unit/body/department within a government that is tendering and contracting the project. The public counterpart in the PPP contract.

sources.title: Sources
sources.description: The information systems from which the data originates.

publishedDate.title: Published date
publishedDate.description: The date that this release was published.

auctions.title: Auctions
auctions.description: Information from the auction process of the contracting process. There can be more than one auction per contracting process e.g. because an auction is made for each lot that is being bought.

publisher.title: Publisher
publisher.description: Information to uniquely identify the publisher of this release.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the organisation or department responsible for publishing this data.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme that holds the unique identifiers used to identify the item being identified.

uid.title: uid
uid.description: The unique ID for this entity under the given ID scheme. Note the use of 'uid' rather than 'id'. See issue #245.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to identify the publisher.

certificates.title: Certificates
certificates.description: This extension will allow DNV to show more precise information about the certificates been made during the contracting implementation.

currentValue.title: Current Value
currentValue.description: This extension will allow DNV to show more precise information about the different values of the contracting implementation.

openingValue.title: Opening Value
openingValue.description: This extension will allow DNV to show more precise information about initial value of the project adjusted to the opening date of tender process.

progress.title: Progress
progress.description: This extension will allow DNV to show more precise information about the progress of a contracting process.

workDetails.title: Work Details
workDetails.description: The work details section is used to publish information about the global status and type of management of the contracting process.

recordPackageURI.title: Record Package URI
recordPackageURI.description: A URI pointing to a record package for this contracting process

procedure.title: Procedure
procedure.description: Procedure to be checked whether is accelerated

withheldInformation.title: Withheld information
withheldInformation.description: Details of items of information whose publication is temporarily or permanently withheld.

packageMetadata.title: Package metadata
packageMetadata.description: Package metadata is hoisted from the package-level to the release-level in APIs.

uri.title: Package Identifier
uri.description: The URI of this package that identifies it uniquely in the world.

publishedDate.title: Published date
publishedDate.description: The date that this package was published. Ideally this should be the latest date that there is release information in this package.

publisher.title: Publisher
publisher.description: Information to uniquely identify the publisher of this package.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the organization or department responsible for publishing this data.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme that holds the unique identifiers used to identify the item being identified.

uid.title: uid
uid.description: The unique ID for this entity under the given ID scheme. Note the use of 'uid' rather than 'id'. See issue #245.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to identify the publisher.

license.title: License
license.description: A link to the license that applies to the data in this package. A Public Domain Dedication or [Open Definition Conformant](http://opendefinition.org/licenses/) license is strongly recommended. The canonical URI of the license should be used. Documents linked from this file may be under other license conditions.

publicationPolicy.title: Publication policy
publicationPolicy.description: A link to a document describing the publishers [publication policy](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/implementation/publication_policy/).

links.description: Add Links to events in a contracting process
links.title: Link

lastUpdate.title: Last release update
lastUpdate.description: The date this information was last released, or published.

Planning.title: Planning
Planning.description: Information from the planning phase of the contracting process. Note that many other fields can be filled in a planning release, in the appropriate fields in other schema sections; these would likely be estimates at this stage, e.g. value in tender.

rationale.title: Rationale
rationale.description: The rationale for the procurement provided in free text. More detail can be provided in an attached document.

budget.title: Budget
budget.description: Details of the budget that funds this contracting process.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: A list of documents related to the planning process.

milestones.title: Planning milestones
milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the planning stage.

project.title: Project information
project.description: Information about the infrastructure or public-private partnership project to which the planning process is related.

id.title: Project identifier
id.description: An externally provided identifier for the project. This might be drawn from a projects register, or may be based on the canonical version of a project name. Project IDs should be unique to a publisher. URIs can be used.

title.title: Project title
title.description: The name of the project to which this contracting process relates. Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the name by which the project is known in that registry.

description.title: Project description
description.description: A short free text description of the project.

totalValue.title: Total project value
totalValue.description: The total anticipated value of the project over it's lifetime.

uri.title: Linked project information
uri.description: A URI pointing to further information about this project.

sector.title: Project sector
sector.description: A high-level categorization of the main sector this procurement process relates to. Use of [UN COFOG codes](http://unstats.un.org/unsd/cr/registry/regcst.asp?Cl=4&Lg=1), with 'COFOG' as the classification scheme, and the numerical COFOG code is recommended for the primary sector classification.

additionalClassifications.title: Additional sector classifications
additionalClassifications.description: Additional project classification, by other sector classifications, or using other classification schemes (e.g. against a strategic framework).

locations.title: Project location
locations.description: Information about the location where a project is taking place.

forecasts.title: Forecasts
forecasts.description: Any forecasts metrics for a future contracting process.

estimatedDate.title: The tender estimated date
estimatedDate.description: The estimated date for the tender.

investmentProjects.title: Investment Projects
investmentProjects.description: The data related to the investment projects to which this planning belongs

items.title: Planned items to be procured
items.description: The goods and services planned to be purchased, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but a quantity of 2 specified instead.

budgetBreakdown.title: Budget breakdown
budgetBreakdown.description: A detailed breakdown of the budget by period and/or participating funders.

hasQuotes.title: Has quotes?
hasQuotes.description: A true/false field to indicate whether any quotes were received during the planning process.

requestsForQuotes.title: Requests for quotes
requestsForQuotes.description: A list of requests for quotes related to the planning process.

requestingUnits.title: requestingUnit
requestingUnits.description: The specific units inside the buyer who require the acquisition or lease of goods, or the provision of services, or those that will benefit from the procurement.

responsibleUnits.title: responsibleUnit
responsibleUnits.description: The specific units inside the buyer who are responsible for the supervision of the contracts implementation.

contractingUnits.title: contractingUnit
contractingUnits.description: The specific units inside the buyer or the procuring entity who are responsible for carrying out the contracting process. They are gennerally involved in the tender, award and contract stages.

Tender.title: Tender
Tender.description: Data regarding tender process - publicly inviting prospective contractors to submit bids for evaluation and selecting a winner or winners.

id.title: Tender ID
id.description: An identifier for this tender process. This may be the same as the ocid, or may be an internal identifier for this tender.

title.title: Tender title
title.description: A title for this tender. This will often be used by applications as a headline to attract interest, and to help analysts understand the nature of this procurement.

description.title: Tender description
description.description: A summary description of the tender. This complements any structured information provided using the items array. Descriptions should be short and easy to read. Avoid using ALL CAPS.

status.title: Tender status
status.description: The current status of the tender, from the closed [tenderStatus](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#tender-status) codelist.

procuringEntity.title: Procuring entity
procuringEntity.description: The entity managing the procurement. This may be different from the buyer who pays for, or uses, the items being procured.

items.title: Items to be procured
items.description: The goods and services to be purchased, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but the quantity specified instead.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total upper estimated value of the procurement. A negative value indicates that the contracting process may involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

minValue.title: Minimum value
minValue.description: The minimum estimated value of the procurement.  A negative value indicates that the contracting process may involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

procurementMethod.title: Procurement method
procurementMethod.description: The procurement method, from the closed [method](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#method) codelist.

procurementMethodDetails.title: Procurement method details
procurementMethodDetails.description: Additional detail on the procurement method used. This field can be used to provide the local name of the particular procurement method used.

procurementMethodRationale.title: Procurement method rationale
procurementMethodRationale.description: Rationale for the chosen procurement method. This is especially important to provide a justification in the case of limited tenders or direct awards.

mainProcurementCategory.title: Main procurement category
mainProcurementCategory.description: The primary category describing the main object of this contracting process, from the closed [procurementCategory](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#procurement-category) codelist.

additionalProcurementCategories.title: Additional procurement categories
additionalProcurementCategories.description: Any additional categories describing the objects of this contracting process, using the open [extendedProcurementCategory](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#extended-procurement-category) codelist.

awardCriteria.title: Award criteria
awardCriteria.description: The award criteria for the procurement, using the open [awardCriteria](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#award-criteria) codelist.

awardCriteriaDetails.title: Award criteria details
awardCriteriaDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the award or selection criteria.

submissionMethod.title: Submission method
submissionMethod.description: The methods by which bids are submitted, using the open [submissionMethod](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#submission-method) codelist.

submissionMethodDetails.title: Submission method details
submissionMethodDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the submission method. This can include the address, e-mail address or online service to which bids are submitted, and any special requirements to be followed for submissions.

tenderPeriod.title: Tender period
tenderPeriod.description: The period when the tender is open for submissions. The end date is the closing date for tender submissions.

enquiryPeriod.title: Enquiry period
enquiryPeriod.description: The period during which potential bidders may submit questions and requests for clarification to the entity managing procurement. Details of how to submit enquiries should be provided in attached notices, or in submissionMethodDetails. Structured dates for when responses to questions will be made can be provided using tender milestones.

hasEnquiries.title: Has enquiries?
hasEnquiries.description: A true/false field to indicate whether any enquiries were received during the tender process. Structured information on enquiries that were received, and responses to them, can be provided using the enquiries extension.

eligibilityCriteria.title: Eligibility criteria
eligibilityCriteria.description: A description of any eligibility criteria for potential suppliers.

awardPeriod.title: Evaluation and award period
awardPeriod.description: The period for decision making regarding the contract award. The end date should be the date on which an award decision is due to be finalized. The start date may be used to indicate the start of an evaluation period.

contractPeriod.description: The period over which the contract is estimated or required to be active. If the tender does not specify explicit dates, the duration field may be used.
contractPeriod.title: Contract period

numberOfTenderers.title: Number of tenderers
numberOfTenderers.description: The number of parties who submit a bid.

tenderers.title: Tenderers
tenderers.description: All parties who submit a bid on a tender. More detailed information on bids and the bidding organization can be provided using the bid extension.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the tender, including any notices. See the [documentType](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#document-type) codelist for details of potential documents to include. Common documents include official legal notices of tender, technical specifications, evaluation criteria, and, as a tender process progresses, clarifications and replies to queries.

milestones.title: Milestones
milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the tender.

amendments.description: A tender amendment is a formal change to the tender, and generally involves the publication of a new tender notice/release. The rationale and a description of the changes made can be provided here.
amendments.title: Amendments

amendment.title: Amendment
amendment.description: The use of individual amendment objects has been deprecated. From OCDS 1.1 information should be provided in the amendments array.

deprecated.description: The single amendment object has been deprecated in favour of including amendments in an amendments (plural) array.

targets.title: Targets
targets.description: Any target metrics for this contracting process.

criteria.title: Criteria
criteria.description: Criteria on which bids, tenderers, lots or items will be judged, evaluated or assessed.

hasTenderInformationProtectedByLaw.description: Whether an protected information is used.
hasTenderInformationProtectedByLaw.title: Protected information used

mainProcurementCategoryDetails.title: Main Procurement Category Details
mainProcurementCategoryDetails.description: The local name of the Main Procurement Category

statusDetails.title: Status Details
statusDetails.description: Additional detail on the status of the tender. This field can be used to provide the local name of the status.

notifiedSuppliers.title: Notified Suppliers
notifiedSuppliers.description: A list of suppliers that have been invited to bid in this tender. This invitation does not implies that other suppliers cannot make a bid or that the notified ones will do

suitability.title: Suitability
suitability.description: Information about the suitability of the contracting process to different types of tenderers.

clarificationMeetings.title: Clarification meetings
clarificationMeetings.description: A list of the clarifications meetings related to the tender section.

locations.title: Locations
locations.description: Location information directly at tender level

identifiers.title: Additional tender identifiers
identifiers.description: Additional identifiers for this tender. This field can be used to provide local identifiers for the tender.

bidOpening.title: Bid opening
bidOpening.description: The date, time, place and other details of the public bid opening.

communication.title: Communication
communication.description: Modalities of communication about key events.

contractTerms.title: Contract terms
contractTerms.description: Information about the terms governing the future contracts from the procedure.

coveredBy.title: Covered by
coveredBy.description: The international legal instruments that the contracting process is covered by.

designContest.title: Design contest
designContest.description: Information about the organization of a design contest.

essentialAssets.title: Essentials assets
essentialAssets.description: Information about the assets used for the provision of public services.

hasEssentialAssets.title: Has essential assets
hasEssentialAssets.description: Whether there is information about the assets used for the provision of public services.

reviewDetails.title: Review details
reviewDetails.description: Precise information concerning the time limits for the review procedures or contact information from which it can be obtained.

valueCalculationMethod.title: Value calculation method
valueCalculationMethod.description: The method used for calculating the estimated value of the concession.

legislativeReferences.title: Legislative references
legislativeReferences.description: Legislative references and associated contact points for information.

exclusionGrounds.title: Exclusion grounds
exclusionGrounds.description: Information about the criteria regarding the situation of a tenderer that can lead to its exclusion from the contracting process. For example: criminal convictions, bankruptcy, presence on a blacklist or failure to pay taxes.

crossBorderLaw.title: Cross-border law
crossBorderLaw.description: In case of joint procurement, the public procurement legislation that applies to the procedure.

legalBasis.title: Legal basis
legalBasis.description: The legal basis of the procedure.

deliveryLocations.title: Delivery Locations
deliveryLocations.description: The locations where activity related to this tender will take place.

deliveryAddresses.title: Delivery Addresses
deliveryAddresses.description: The addresses to which, or where, goods or services related to this tender will be delivered.

lots.title: Lots
lots.description: A tender process can be divided into lots, where bidders can bid on one or more lots. Details of each lot can be provided here. Items, documents and other features may then reference the lot they are related to using relatedLot. Where no relatedLots identifier is given, the values ought to be interpreted as applicable to the whole tender. Details about the whole tender can be overridden for a given lot through their inclusion in the lot object.

lotDetails.title: Lot Details
lotDetails.description: Details of any criteria that apply to bidding on the lots in this tender.

maximumLotsBidPerSupplier.title: Maximum lots per supplier
maximumLotsBidPerSupplier.description: The maximum number of lots that one supplier can bid on as part of this contracting process.

maximumLotsAwardedPerSupplier.title: Maximum lots per supplier
maximumLotsAwardedPerSupplier.description: The maximum number of lots that can be awarded to one supplier as part of this contracting process.

awardCriteriaDetails.title: Award criteria details
awardCriteriaDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the award or selection criteria.

lotGroups.title: Lot groups
lotGroups.description: Where the buyer reserves the right to combine lots, or wishes to specify the total value for a group of lots, a lot group is used to capture this information.

hasOptions.title: Options used
hasOptions.description: Whether the buyer is expected to reserve the right to make additional purchases from the supplier.

otherRequirements.title: Other requirements
otherRequirements.description: Other requirements to participate in the procedure.

participationFees.title: Participation fees
participationFees.description: Any fees applicable to bidders wishing to participate in the tender process. Fees can apply for accessing bidding documents or for submitting bids, or there can be a "win fee" payable by the successful bidder.

procurementMethodRationaleClassification.title: Procurement method rationale classifications
procurementMethodRationaleClassification.description: The classifications of the procurement method rationale.

recurrence.title: Recurrence
recurrence.description: Information on the recurrence of the contracting process.

hasRecurrence.title: Has recurrence
hasRecurrence.description: Whether the contracting process is recurrent.

hasRenewal.title: Has renewal
hasRenewal.description: Whether the buyer is expected to reserve the right to renew the future contract(s).

renewal.title: Renewal
renewal.description: The options for the renewal of the contract(s).

secondStage.title: Second stage
secondStage.description: Information about the second stage of a two-stage procedure (e.g. a restricted procedure, a competitive procedure with negotiation, a competitive dialogue or an innovation partnership).

selectionCriteria.title: Selection criteria
selectionCriteria.description: The minimum requirements for potential suppliers to participate in the contracting process. Selection criteria ensure that a potential supplier has the legal and financial capacities and the technical and professional abilities to perform the contract.

subcontractingTerms.title: Subcontracting terms
subcontractingTerms.description: Information about the terms governing subcontracting.

submissionTerms.title: Submission terms
submissionTerms.description: Information about the submission terms to describe how, when and where the tenderers need to submit their bids or expressions of interest for the procedure.

hasSustainability.title: Has sustainability
hasSustainability.description: Whether the contracting process incorporates Sustainable Public Procurement.

sustainability.title: Sustainability
sustainability.description: Information about how the contracting process incorporates Sustainable Public Procurement.

techniques.title: Techniques
techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

competitive.title: Is the framework agreement call-off competitive?
competitive.description: Whether this call-off is competitive or not.

enquiries.title: Enquiries
enquiries.description: Questions sent to the procuring entity, and the answers given

classification.title: Tender classification
classification.description: The primary classification of the contracting process.

additionalClassifications.title: Tender additional classifications
additionalClassifications.description: Additional classifications of the contracting process.

complaints.description: Complaints to tender conditions and their resolutions
complaints.title: Complaint

complaintPeriod.description: The timeframe when complaints can be submitted.
complaintPeriod.title: Complaint period

guarantee.title: Guarantee
guarantee.description: A sum of money which the Economic Operator  may set out in tender documentation and which the Participant (Award of Tender/Lot) shall pay in case of a refusal to sign the Contract, or in other cases foreseen in the Law.

cause.title: Cause
cause.description: Cause of negotiations. See Article 35 of the Law of Ukraine "On Public Procurement". Required for openprocurement.limited

causeDescription.title: Cause description
causeDescription.description: Reasoning behind usage of negotiations. Required for openprocurement.limited

pendingCancellation.title: Cancellation pending
pendingCancellation.description: Yes or No field showing  whether a lot is pending for cancellation.

qualificationPeriod.description: The timeframe when qualifications can be submitted.
qualificationPeriod.title: Qualification period

localProcurementCategory.title: Local Procurement Category
localProcurementCategory.description: The procurement category as defined in the source systems.

datePublished.title: Date Published
datePublished.description: The date when the tender was published.

awardAddress.title: Lugar de adjudicación
awardAddress.description: Contiene la ubicación física indicado en la licitación para la adjudicación

expressionAddress.title: Dirección física expresiones
expressionAddress.description: Dirección física para enviar las expresiones de interés por parte de los interesados

expressionEmail.title: Correo expresiones de interés
expressionEmail.description: Contiene un correo para remitir las expresiones de interés por parte de los oferentes

conversions.title: Conversions
conversions.description: A list of weightings for the used criteria or applicable options

Award.title: Award
Award.description: An award for the given procurement. There can be more than one award per contracting process e.g. because the contract is split among different providers, or because it is a standing offer.

id.title: Award ID
id.description: The identifier for this award. It must be unique and must not change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

description.title: Description
description.description: Award description

status.title: Award status
status.description: The current status of the award, from the closed [awardStatus](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#award-status) codelist.

date.title: Award date
date.description: The date of the contract award. This is usually the date on which a decision to award was made.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total value of this award. In the case of a framework contract this may be the total estimated lifetime value, or maximum value, of the agreement. There may be more than one award per procurement. A negative value indicates that the award may involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

suppliers.title: Suppliers
suppliers.description: The suppliers awarded this award. If different suppliers have been awarded different items or values, these should be split into separate award blocks.

items.title: Items awarded
items.description: The goods and services awarded in this award, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but the quantity specified instead.

contractPeriod.title: Contract period
contractPeriod.description: The period for which the contract has been awarded.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the award, including any notices.

amendments.description: An award amendment is a formal change to the details of the award, and generally involves the publication of a new award notice/release. The rationale and a description of the changes made can be provided here.
amendments.title: Amendments

amendment.title: Amendment
amendment.description: The use of individual amendment objects has been deprecated. From OCDS 1.1 information should be provided in the amendments array.

deprecated.description: The single amendment object has been deprecated in favour of including amendments in an amendments (plural) array.

relatedBid.title: Related bid
relatedBid.description: Where bid details are used, a cross reference to the entry in the bids array to which this award relates. Provide the bid identifier here.

deprecated.description: This field is deprecated in favor of `relatedBids`, to allow an award to combine multiple bids.

agreedMetrics.title: Agreed metrics
agreedMetrics.description: Any target metrics set out as part of the contract award.

requirementResponses.title: Requirement responses
requirementResponses.description: A list of the detailed responses of this award to the requirements of the tender.

preferredBidders.title: Preferred bidders
preferredBidders.description: The bidder or bidders awarded this award, the preferred bidder(s) will become the counter party or parties of the procuring authority in the PPP contract when the contract is signed.

evaluationIndicators.title: Evaluation of PPP option
evaluationIndicators.description: Key indicators that describe how the PPP option has been evaluated by government.

statusDetails.title: Status Details
statusDetails.description: Additional detail on the status of the award. This field can be used to provide the local name of the status.

datePublished.title: Date published
datePublished.description: The date that the award was published.

rationale.title: Award rationale
rationale.description: A short summary of the reasons for making this specific award, and/or selecting the particular supplier, provided in free text. More detail can be provided in attached documents.

enteredValue.title: entered value
enteredValue.description: valor capturado en la plataforma de adquisiciones

correctedValue.title: corrected value
correctedValue.description: ajuste metodológico realizado a los valores atípicos de adjudicación

maximumValue.title: Maximum value
maximumValue.description: The estimated maximum value of the framework agreement, as a whole, as estimated when making the award.

estimatedValue.title: Estimated value
estimatedValue.description: The estimated value of the framework agreement, as a whole, as estimated when making the award.

relatedBids.title: Related bids
relatedBids.description: The identifiers of the bids (or expressions of interest) to which the award relates.

buyers.title: Buyers
buyers.description: The organizations aiming to conclude a contract with the suppliers or to use the goods, services or works resulting from the contract, if not identical to the buyers for the contracting process.

valueCalculationMethod.title: Value calculation method
valueCalculationMethod.description: Any details relevant to the value of the concession according to article 8(3) of Directive 2014/23/EU on concession contracts.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this award relates.

hasOptions.title: Options used
hasOptions.description: Whether the buyer is expected to reserve the right to make additional purchases from the supplier.

hasRenewal.title: Has renewal
hasRenewal.description: Whether the buyer is expected to reserve the right to renew the future contract(s).

renewal.title: Renewal
renewal.description: The options for the renewal of the contract(s).

hasSubcontracting.title: Subcontracting involved
hasSubcontracting.description: Whether a part of the contract will be subcontracted.

subcontracting.title: Subcontracting
subcontracting.description: Information about the parts of the contract that the supplier will subcontract to third parties.

valueBreakdown.title: Value breakdown
valueBreakdown.description: Information about the value breakdown of the award value, such as applied discounts and charges.

complaints.description: Complaints to award conditions and their resolutions
complaints.title: Complaint

complaintPeriod.description: The timeframe when complaints can be submitted.
complaintPeriod.title: Complaint period

eligible.title: Eligible
eligible.description: Confirms compliance of eligibility criteria set by the procuring entity in the tendering documents

qualified.title: Qualified
qualified.description: Confirms the absence of grounds for refusal to participate in accordance with Article 17 of the Law of Ukraine "On Public Procurement".

Contract.title: Contract
Contract.description: Information regarding the signed contract between the buyer and supplier(s).

id.title: Contract ID
id.description: The identifier for this contract. It must be unique and must not change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

awardID.title: Award ID
awardID.description: The award.id against which this contract is being issued.

description.title: Contract description
description.description: Contract description

status.title: Contract status
status.description: The current status of the contract, from the closed [contractStatus](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#contract-status) codelist.

period.title: Period
period.description: The start and end date for the contract.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total value of this contract. A negative value indicates that the contract will involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

items.title: Items contracted
items.description: The goods, services, and any intangible outcomes in this contract. Note: If the items are the same as the award do not repeat.

dateSigned.title: Date signed
dateSigned.description: The date the contract was signed. In the case of multiple signatures, the date of the last signature.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the contract, including any notices.

implementation.title: Implementation
implementation.description: Information related to the implementation of the contract in accordance with the obligations laid out therein.

relatedProcesses.description: The details of related processes: for example, if this process is followed by one or more contracting processes, represented under a separate open contracting identifier (ocid). This is commonly used to refer to subcontracts and to renewal or replacement processes for this contract.
relatedProcesses.title: Related processes

milestones.title: Contract milestones
milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the finalization of this contract.

amendments.description: A contract amendment is a formal change to, or extension of, a contract, and generally involves the publication of a new contract notice/release, or some other documents detailing the change. The rationale and a description of the changes made can be provided here.
amendments.title: Amendments

amendment.title: Amendment
amendment.description: The use of individual amendment objects has been deprecated. From OCDS 1.1 information should be provided in the amendments array.

deprecated.description: The single amendment object has been deprecated in favour of including amendments in an amendments (plural) array.

finance.title: Finance
finance.description: Information about financing arrangements for this contract.

agreedMetrics.title: Agreed metrics
agreedMetrics.description: Any target metrics set out as part of the contract documents.

requirementResponses.title: Requirement responses
requirementResponses.description: A list of the detailed responses of this contract to the requirements of the tender.

riskAllocation.title: Risk allocation
riskAllocation.description: Information on the allocation of risks relating to the contract.

signatories.title: Contract signatories
signatories.description: The signatories to the contract. Each signatory should have a corresponding entry in the `parties` array.

tariffs.title: Tariffs
tariffs.description: The tariffs as set out in the contract schedules. Also known as tolls or user charges. Updates to tariffs over the operation of the contract can be provided in the implementation section.

financeSummary.title: Finance summary
financeSummary.description: Key indicators that describe the financial model of the PPP.

statusDetails.title: Status Details
statusDetails.description: Additional detail on the status of the contract. This field can be used to provide the local name of the status

investmentProjects.title: Investment Projects
investmentProjects.description: The data related to the investment projects to which this contract belongs

guarantees.title: Guarantees
guarantees.description: A list of the guarantees given for this contract.

surveillanceMechanisms.title: Surveillance mechanisms
surveillanceMechanisms.description: The surveillance mechanisms used in this contracting process. The mechanisms should be taken from the [surveillanceMechanisms](https://github.com/INAImexico/ocds_surveillanceMechanisms_extension/blob/master/codelists/surveillanceMechanisms.csv) codelist.

identifiers.title: Additional contract identifiers
identifiers.description: Additional identifiers for this contract. This field can be used to provide local identifiers for the contract.

relatedBids.title: Related bids
relatedBids.description: The identifiers of the bids (or expressions of interest) to which the contract relates.

buyer.title: Buyer
buyer.description: The organization aiming to conclude a contract with the suppliers or to use the goods, services or works resulting from the contract, if not identical to the buyer for the contracting process.

periodRationale.title: Contract period rationale
periodRationale.description: The rationale for the duration of the contract.

publicPassengerTransportServicesKilomete.title: Kilometers of public passenger transport services
publicPassengerTransportServicesKilomete.description: The number of kilometers of public passenger transport services provided by a public service contract.

hasOptions.title: Options used
hasOptions.description: Whether the buyer reserves the right to make additional purchases from the supplier.

hasRenewal.title: Has renewal
hasRenewal.description: Whether the buyer reserves the right to renew the contract.

renewal.title: Renewal
renewal.description: The options for the renewal of the contract.

suppliers.title: Suppliers
suppliers.description: The suppliers explicitly named in this contract.

extendsContractID.title: Extends contract ID
extendsContractID.description: If this contract extends or amends a previously issued contract, then the contract.id value for the extended/amended contract can be provided here.

valueBreakdown.title: Value breakdown
valueBreakdown.description: Information about the value breakdown of the contract value, such as applied discounts and charges.

localProcurementCategory.title: Local Procurement Category
localProcurementCategory.description: The procurement category as defined in the source systems.

valueWithTax.title: Value With Tax
valueWithTax.description: The value of the contract with tax included

amount.title: Amount of the contract with tax
amount.description: The value of the contract with tax included

currency.title: Currency of the contract with tax
currency.description: Acronym of the type of currency with which the contract is signed. The currency should always be specified using the uppercase 3-letter currency code from ISO4217.

contractDetails.title: Contract details
contractDetails.description: Additional contract information as provided by SHCP (Mexico).

contractType.title: Contract Type
contractType.description: Name of the type of contract to be concluded.

fiscalYearValue.title: Fiscal year value
fiscalYearValue.description: When the term of a contract covers more than one cycle, the multi-year amount reflects the amount of money allocated per cycle.

amount.title: Amount for the fiscal year.
amount.description: Numerical figure for the amount to be disbursed in the fiscal year.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Acronym of the type of currency with which the contract is signed. The currency should always be specified using the uppercase 3-letter currency code from ISO4217.

maxValue.title: Maximum value
maxValue.description: Maximum amount to be paid established in the contract.

amount.title: Amount of the maximum value.
amount.description: Numerical value of the maximum amount established in the contract.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Acronym of the type of currency with which the contract is signed. The currency should always be specified using the uppercase 3-letter currency code from ISO4217.

minValue.title: Minimum value
minValue.description: Minimum amount to be paid established in the contract.

amount.title: Amount of the minimum value.
amount.description: Numerical value of the minimum amount established in the contract.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Acronym of the type of currency with which the contract is signed. The currency should always be specified using the uppercase 3-letter currency code from ISO4217.

originalCurrencyValue.title: Original Currency Value
originalCurrencyValue.description: Total amount of the contract in the type of currency with which you are subscribed.

amount.title: Amount of the original currency value
amount.description: Numerical value for the total amount of the contract in the type of currency with which you are subscribed.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Acronym of the type of currency with which the contract is signed. The currency should always be specified using the uppercase 3-letter currency code from ISO4217.

exchangeRate.title: Exchange rate
exchangeRate.description: Exchange rate, if foreign currency, which will be taken for conversion to national currency.

multiyear.title: Multi-year
multiyear.description: Temporality of the commitment (annual or pluriannual). Indicate if the contract covers more than one budget cycle.

numberOfMonths.title: Number of months
numberOfMonths.description: Indicates the number of months and days covered by the contract if it is multi-year.

priceScheme.title: Price scheme
priceScheme.description: Description of the payment conditions under which contracts may be agreed.

buyers.title: Buyers
buyers.description: A buyer is an entity whose budget will be used to purchase the goods, works or services covered by this contract. If each buyer signs a separate contract, they should be listed against separate contracts in the contracts array. This array can be used when multiple buyers are party to the same contract.

Implementation.title: Implementation
Implementation.description: Information during the performance / implementation stage of the contract.

transactions.title: Transactions
transactions.description: A list of the spending transactions made against this contract

milestones.title: Milestones
milestones.description: As milestones are completed, the milestone's status and dates should be updated.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Documents and reports that are part of the implementation phase e.g. audit and evaluation reports.

charges.title: Charges
charges.description: Information on the revenue to be raised through charges, as set out in the contract or as subsequently revised during the life of the project.

metrics.title: Metrics
metrics.description: Reported results from the delivery of the contracted goods, works or services.

performanceFailures.title: Performance failure disclosures
performanceFailures.description: An array of performance failure disclosures, detailing performance failures for different periods and categories.

tariffs.title: Tariffs
tariffs.description: The tariffs as they apply during the life of the project. Also known as tolls or user charges. These may be initially copied from the contract section, and then updated with any revisions over the lifetime of the implementation phase.

purchaseOrders.title: Purchase Orders
purchaseOrders.description: A list of the purchase orders made against this contract

budgetBreakdown.title: Budget breakdown
budgetBreakdown.description: A detailed breakdown of the budget by period and/or participating funders.

status.title: Implementation status
status.description: The current status of the contract implementation based on the [implementationStatuscodelist](https://github.com/INAImexico/ocds_implementationStatus_extension/blob/master/codelists/implementationStatus).

financialProgress.title: Financial progress
financialProgress.description: The financial progress section allows high-level and detailed information on amounts committed or spent to date for this particular contract. This may be used alongside the transactions section, which allows for details of each individual payment to be recorded.

totalSpend.title: Total spend
totalSpend.description: The total spend on this contract at the date of last update. Note that the exact fiscal measure this number represents may vary between data publishers (e.g. amount invoiced vs. amount transferred to the bank account of the supplier).

measures.title: Measures
measures.description: This measures section reports aggregated financial progress figures for this contract (i.e. without breakdown by budget classifications). Measures must be provided as a set of key-value pairs, where the key should be the name of the measure used within a related Fiscal Data Package dataset or other budget and spending dataset. The value is the value of this measure when last updated, and must be provided as a number in the same default currency as any aggregate reported budget or spending figures.

breakdown.title: Financial progress breakdown
breakdown.description: This section contains a breakdown of financial progress, allowing various measures (amount invoiced, amount accrued, amount paid etc.) to be disaggregated by source, period and budget classification

endDate.title: End date
endDate.description: The actual date when contract implementation ended. Where `implementation/endDate` varies from the anticipated `contracts/period/endDate` an explanation of the variance should be provided in `implementation/endDateDetails`.

endDateDetails.title: End date details
endDateDetails.description: Details related to the endDate. This may be a justification for the contract's completion date being different than in the original contract.

finalValue.title: Final value
finalValue.description: The actual total value of all payments for a completed contract. If `implementation/transactions` are used for this contract, this field should equal the sum of the `transaction/value/amount` fields. Where `finalValue/amount` varies from `contracts/value/amount` an explanation of the variance should be provided in `finalValueDetails`.

finalValueDetails.title: Final value details
finalValueDetails.description: Details related to the final value. This may be a justification for the completed contract's value being different than in the original contract.

Milestone.title: Milestone
Milestone.description: The milestone block can be used to represent a wide variety of events in the lifetime of a contracting process.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier for this milestone, unique within this block. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a milestone through the compilation from release to record mechanism.

type.title: Milestone type
type.description: The nature of the milestone, using the open [milestoneType](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#milestone-type) codelist.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the milestone.

code.title: Milestone code
code.description: Milestone codes can be used to track specific events that take place for a particular kind of contracting process. For example, a code of 'approvalLetter' can be used to allow applications to understand this milestone represents the date an approvalLetter is due or signed.

dueDate.title: Due date
dueDate.description: The date the milestone is due.

dateMet.title: Date met
dateMet.description: The date on which the milestone was met.

dateModified.title: Date modified
dateModified.description: The date the milestone was last reviewed or modified and the status was altered or confirmed to still be correct.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status that was realized on the date provided in `dateModified`, from the closed [milestoneStatus](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#milestone-status) codelist.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: A list of documents specifically associated with this milestone.

deprecated.description: Inclusion of documents at the milestone level is now deprecated. Documentation should be attached in the tender, award, contract or implementation sections, and titles and descriptions used to highlight the related milestone. Publishers who wish to continue to provide documents at the milestone level should explicitly declare this by using the milestone documents extension.

purcharseOrderId.title: Related purchase order
purcharseOrderId.description: The purchase order id related to this milestone

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this milestone relates.

Document.title: Document
Document.description: Links to, or descriptions of, external documents can be attached at various locations within the standard. Documents can be supporting information, formal notices, downloadable forms, or any other kind of resource that ought to be made public as part of full open contracting.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local, unique identifier for this document. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a document through the compilation from release to record mechanism.

documentType.title: Document type
documentType.description: A classification of the document described, using the open [documentType](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#document-type) codelist.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of the document. Descriptions are recommended to not exceed 250 words. In the event the document is not accessible online, the description field can be used to describe arrangements for obtaining a copy of the document.

url.title: URL
url.description: A direct link to the document or attachment. The server providing access to this document ought to be configured to correctly report the document mime type.

datePublished.title: Date published
datePublished.description: The date on which the document was first published. This is particularly important for legally important documents such as notices of a tender.

dateModified.title: Date modified
dateModified.description: Date that the document was last modified

format.title: Format
format.description: The format of the document, using the open [IANA Media Types](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/) codelist (see the values in the 'Template' column), or using the 'offline/print' code if the described document is published offline. For example, web pages have a format of 'text/html'.

language.title: Language
language.description: The language of the linked document using either two-letter [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of lowercase two-letter codes from [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is recommended unless there is a clear user need for distinguishing the language subtype.

pageStart.title: Page start
pageStart.description: When the information referenced exists within a large document, indicate the first page on which it can be found. This should refer to the printed page number, not the page number reported by software applications.

pageEnd.title: Page end
pageEnd.description: When the information referenced exists within a large document, indicate the last page on which it can be found. This should refer to the printed page number, not the page number reported by software applications.

accessDetails.title: Access details
accessDetails.description: A description of any special arrangements needed to access this document, for example: registering for access, paying a fee, or visiting a location to inspect the document.

author.title: Author
author.description: The names of the authors of the document.

documentTypeDetails.title: Document Type Details
documentTypeDetails.description: The local name of the document type

languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The languages used in the document, from the open [language](https://standard.open-contracting.org/{{version}}/{{lang}}/schema/codelists/#language) codelist. A [BCP47 language tag](https://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/) is allowed, if there is a user need for the additional information.

publisher.title: Publisher
publisher.description: The organization responsible for making the document available.

accessDetailsURL.title: Access details URL
accessDetailsURL.description: A web address for information on any special arrangements needed to access the document.

unofficialTranslations.title: Unofficial translations
unofficialTranslations.description: The languages in which unofficial translations of the document are available, from the open [language](https://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/codelists/#language) codelist. A [BCP47 language tag](https://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/) is allowed, if there is a user need for the additional information.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this document relates.

relatedItem.title: Related Item
relatedItem.description: Identifier of the item that the document belongs to

documentScope.title: Document scope
documentScope.description: Entity to which the document belongs

Budget.title: Budget information
Budget.description: This section contains information about the budget line, and associated projects, through which this contracting process is funded. It draws upon the data model of the [Fiscal Data Package](https://frictionlessdata.io/specs/fiscal-data-package/), and should be used to cross-reference to more detailed information held using a Budget Data Package, or, where no linked Budget Data Package is available, to provide enough information to allow a user to manually or automatically cross-reference with another published source of budget and project information.

id.title: ID
id.description: An identifier for the budget line item which provides funds for this contracting process. This identifier should be possible to cross-reference against the provided data source.

description.title: Budget Source
description.description: A short free text description of the budget source. May be used to provide the title of the budget line, or the programme used to fund this project.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The value reserved in the budget for this contracting process. A negative value indicates anticipated income to the budget as a result of this contracting process, rather than expenditure. Where the budget is drawn from multiple sources, the budget breakdown extension can be used.

project.title: Project title
project.description: The name of the project through which this contracting process is funded (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the name by which the project is known in that registry. No translation option is offered for this string, as translated values can be provided in third-party data, linked from the data source above.

projectID.title: Project identifier
projectID.description: An external identifier for the project that this contracting process forms part of, or is funded via (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the identifier from the relevant registry of projects.

uri.title: Linked budget information
uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a machine-readable record about the budget line-item or line-items that fund this contracting process. Information can be provided in a range of formats, including using IATI, the Open Fiscal Data Standard or any other standard which provides structured data on budget sources. Human readable documents can be included using the planning.documents block.

source.title: Data Source
source.description: (Deprecated in 1.1) Used to point either to a corresponding Budget Data Package, or to a machine or human-readable source where users can find further information on the budget line item identifiers, or project identifiers, provided here.

deprecated.description: The budget data source field was intended to link to machine-readable data about the budget for a contracting process, but has been widely mis-used to provide free-text descriptions of budget providers. As a result, it has been removed from version 1.1. budget/uri can be used to provide a link to machine-readable budget information, and budget/description can be used to provide human-readable information on the budget source.

budgetBreakdown.title: Budget breakdown
budgetBreakdown.description: A detailed breakdown of the budget by period and/or participating funders.

finance.title: Finance
finance.description: Information about financing arrangements for a future contracting process.

Transaction.title: Transaction information
Transaction.description: A spending transaction related to the contracting process. Draws upon the data models of the [Fiscal Data Package](https://frictionlessdata.io/specs/fiscal-data-package/) and the [International Aid Transparency Initiative](http://iatistandard.org/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/transaction/) and should be used to cross-reference to more detailed information held using a Fiscal Data Package, IATI file, or to provide enough information to allow a user to manually or automatically cross-reference with some other published source of transactional spending data.

id.title: ID
id.description: A unique identifier for this transaction. This identifier should be possible to cross-reference against the provided data source. For IATI this is the transaction reference.

source.title: Data source
source.description: Used to point either to a corresponding Fiscal Data Package, IATI file, or machine or human-readable source where users can find further information on the budget line item identifiers, or project identifiers, provided here.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of the transaction.

payer.title: Payer
payer.description: An organization reference for the organization from which the funds in this transaction originate.

payee.title: Payee
payee.description: An organization reference for the organization which receives the funds in this transaction.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: (Deprecated in 1.1. Use transaction.value instead) The value of the transaction. A negative value indicates a refund or correction.

deprecated.description: This field has been replaced by the `transaction.value` field for consistency with the use of value and amount elsewhere in the standard.

providerOrganization.title: Provider organization
providerOrganization.description: (Deprecated in 1.1. Use transaction.payer instead.) The Organization Identifier for the organization from which the funds in this transaction originate. Expressed following the Organizational Identifier standard - consult the documentation and the codelist.

deprecated.description: This field has been replaced by the `transaction.payer` field to resolve ambiguity arising from 'provider' being interpreted as relating to the goods or services procured rather than the flow of funds between the parties.

receiverOrganization.title: Receiver organization
receiverOrganization.description: (Deprecated in 1.1. Use transaction.payee instead). The Organization Identifier for the organization which receives the funds in this transaction. Expressed following the Organizational Identifier standard - consult the documentation and the codelist.

deprecated.description: This field has been replaced by the `transaction.payee` field to resolve ambiguity arising from 'receiver' being interpreted as relating to the goods or services procured rather than the flow of funds between the parties.

relatedImplementationMilestone.title: Related implementation milestone
relatedImplementationMilestone.description: A link to the milestone in the implementation section of OCDS to which this transaction relates.

sourceSystem.title: Source System
sourceSystem.description: The system from where this payment comes. It can be SICP or SIAF

financialCode.title: Finantial Code
financialCode.description: The financial code that approves this payment.

paymentMethod.title: Payment method
paymentMethod.description: The payment method used to make the transaction. The values of the paymentMethod codelist must be used (https://github.com/INAImexico/ocds_paymentMethod_extension/blob/master/codelists/paymentMethod.csv).

financialObligationIds.title: Financial Obligation Id
financialObligationIds.description: Information about the financial obligation Id

budgetSources.title: Budget Breakdowns Ids
budgetSources.description: Budget Breakdowns Ids used in this payment

description.title: Description
description.description: Concept of the transfer

requestDate.title: Request Date
requestDate.description: Indicates the date of the transfer order generation

name.description: The name of the party being referenced. This must match the name of an entry in the parties section.
name.title: Organization name

id.description: The id of the party being referenced. This must match the id of an entry in the parties section.
id.title: Organization ID

identifier.title: Primary identifier
identifier.description: The primary identifier for this organization. Identifiers that uniquely pick out a legal entity should be preferred. Consult the [organization identifier guidance](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/identifiers/) for the preferred scheme and identifier to use.

deprecated.description: From version 1.1, organizations should be referenced by their identifier and name in a document, and detailed legal identifier information should only be provided in the relevant cross-referenced entry in the parties section at the top level of a release.

From version 1.1, organizations should be referenced by their identifier and name in a document, and address information should only be provided in the relevant cross-referenced entry in the parties section at the top level of a release.

From version 1.1, organizations should be referenced by their identifier and name in a document, and additional identifiers for an organization should be provided in the relevant cross-referenced entry in the parties section at the top level of a release.

additionalIdentifiers.title: Additional identifiers
additionalIdentifiers.description: (Deprecated outside the parties section) A list of additional / supplemental identifiers for the organization, using the [organization identifier guidance](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/identifiers/). This can be used to provide an internally used identifier for this organization in addition to the primary legal entity identifier.

deprecated.description: From version 1.1, organizations should be referenced by their identifier and name in a document, and contact point information for an organization should be provided in the relevant cross-referenced entry in the parties section at the top level of a release.

OrganizationReference.description: The id and name of the party being referenced. Used to cross-reference to the parties section
OrganizationReference.title: Organization reference

name.title: Common name
name.description: A common name for this organization or other participant in the contracting process. The identifier object provides a space for the formal legal name, and so this may either repeat that value, or may provide the common name by which this organization or entity is known. This field may also include details of the department or sub-unit involved in this contracting process.

id.description: The ID used for cross-referencing to this party from other sections of the release. This field may be built with the following structure {identifier.scheme}-{identifier.id}(-{department-identifier}).
id.title: Entity ID

identifier.title: Primary identifier
identifier.description: The primary identifier for this organization or participant. Identifiers that uniquely pick out a legal entity should be preferred. Consult the [organization identifier guidance](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/identifiers/) for the preferred scheme and identifier to use.

additionalIdentifiers.title: Additional identifiers
additionalIdentifiers.description: A list of additional / supplemental identifiers for the organization or participant, using the [organization identifier guidance](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/identifiers/). This can be used to provide an internally used identifier for this organization in addition to the primary legal entity identifier.

address.title: Address
address.description: An address. This may be the legally registered address of the organization, or may be a correspondence address for this particular contracting process.

contactPoint.title: Contact point
contactPoint.description: Contact details that can be used for this party.

roles.title: Party roles
roles.description: The party's role(s) in the contracting process, using the open [partyRole](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#party-role) codelist.

details.description: Additional classification information about parties can be provided using partyDetail extensions that define particular fields and classification schemes.
details.title: Details

activityTypes.title: Activity Types
activityTypes.description: For commercial organization's, is its activity goods, services or both

categories.title: Party categories
categories.description: The categories in which the supplier is registered

id.description: The category identifier.
id.title: Category ID

name.title: Cagegory Name
name.description: The name of the category

level.title: Nivel
level.description: Nivel de la parte u organización

legalEntityTypeDetail.title: Tipo de compañía
legalEntityTypeDetail.description: Indica el tipo de organización en Colombia: Limitada, Sociedad anónima, Sociedad anónima simplificada, entre otros

entityType.title: Entity Type
entityType.description: Organizational classification according to if the entity is  a sub-national, national, or decentralized entity

type.title: Type
type.description: Determines if the party is a paraguayan 'Entidad' or 'Unidad de Contratación'

vcse.title: VCSE status
vcse.description: If an organisation is a voluntary, community or social enterprise (VCSE) or not.

gender.title: Gender
gender.description: For natural persons, it is their gender, for enterprises females have to have over 50% of shares, or be a manager.

listedOnRegulatedMarket.title: Listed on regulated market
listedOnRegulatedMarket.description: Whether the organization is listed on a regulated market (e.g. a stock exchange) that ensures adequate transparency in line with anti-money laundering legislation.

buyerProfile.title: Buyer profile URL
buyerProfile.description: The Web address of the buyer profile.

classifications.title: Organization classifications
classifications.description: The classifications that categorize the organization.

scale.title: Scale
scale.description: The size or scale of the organization.

IsSmallCompany.title: Is Small Company
IsSmallCompany.description: Indica si la organización corresponde a una MiPyme (Micro, pequeña o mediana empresa)

branch.title: Rama
branch.description: Rama de la parte u organización

BusinessOperationName.description: Nombre de la unidad de negocio de la parte u organización
BusinessOperationName.title: Nombre de la unidad de negocio

isGroup.title: Es grupo
isGroup.description: Indica si la parte u organización corresponde a una Unión Temporal o Consorcio

obligada.title: Obligada
obligada.description: Indica si la parte u organización es obligada

order.title: Orden
order.description: Orden de la parte u organización

sector.title: Sector
sector.description: Sector económico de la parte u organización

shareholders.title: Shareholdings
shareholders.description: Shareholdings in the organization: used to provide company ownership information for firms, primarily in the case of large and complex contracts, like public private partnerships, that require disclosure of this information by bidders or suppliers.

beneficialOwnership.title: Beneficial ownership
beneficialOwnership.description: This section can be used to record information concerning individuals or organizations with a beneficial ownership or control interests in this party. Where structured data is available, this section may be extended by embedding or linking to information modelled using the [Beneficial Ownership Data Standard (BODS)](https://github.com/openownership/data-standard).

description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of beneficial ownership or control arrangements.

position.title: Position
position.description: Position held by the official. This field is used to define the position occupied by the officials attending the clarification meeting.

beneficialOwners.title: Beneficial owners
beneficialOwners.description: The beneficial owners of the organization.

eDeliveryGateway.title: eDelivery gateway
eDeliveryGateway.description: The organization's URL for the exchange of data and documents with eDelivery.

additionalContactPoints.title: Additional contact points
additionalContactPoints.description: An array of additional contact points that may be consulted for information. Additional contact points should each list the languages they operate in their name, and as structured data in the availableLanguage field.

memberOf.title: Member Of
memberOf.description: The organizations of which this organization is a member.

additionalContactPoint.title: Puntos de contacto adicionales
additionalContactPoint.description: Puntos de contacto adicionales de la parte

identifier.title: identificador de puntos de contacto adicionales

Item.title: Item
Item.description: A good, service, or work to be contracted.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier to reference and merge the items by. Must be unique within a given array of items.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the goods, services to be provided.

classification.title: Classification
classification.description: The primary classification for the item.

additionalClassifications.title: Additional classifications
additionalClassifications.description: An array of additional classifications for the item.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The number of units to be provided.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: A description of the unit in which the supplies, services or works are provided (e.g. hours, kilograms) and the unit-price.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The list from which identifiers for units of measure are taken, using the open [unitClassificationScheme](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#unit-classification-scheme) codelist. 'UNCEFACT' is recommended.

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier from the codelist referenced in the `scheme` field. Check the [unitClassificationScheme](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#unit-classification-scheme) codelist for details of how to find and use identifiers from the scheme in use.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the unit.

value.title: Value
value.description: The monetary value of a single unit.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The machine-readable URI for the unit of measure, provided by the scheme.

enteredValue.title: entered value
enteredValue.description: valor capturado en la plataforma de adquisiciones

correctedValue.title: corrected value
correctedValue.description: ajuste metodológico realizado a los valores atípicos de adjudicación

deliveryLocation.title: Delivery Location
deliveryLocation.description: The location where activity related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered, or will take place.

deprecated.description: This field is deprecated in favour of `.deliveryLocations` to support items with multiple delivery locations.

deliveryAddress.title: Delivery Address
deliveryAddress.description: The address to which, or where, goods or services related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered.

deprecated.description: This field is deprecated in favour of `.deliveryAddresses` to support items with multiple delivery locations.

status.title: Item status
status.description: The current status of the item.

position.title: Position
position.description: The position of an item in the entire procurement item list.

totalValue.title: Total item value
totalValue.description: The total monetary value including all units.

beneficiaries.title: Beneficiaries
beneficiaries.description: Information about the beneficiaries of the item

minQuantity.title: Minimum Quantity
minQuantity.description: The minimum number of units to be provided when the tender's type is open contract.

subItems.title: Sub Items
subItems.description: An array of sub items for the item.

deliveryAddresses.title: Delivery Addresses
deliveryAddresses.description: The addresses to which, or where, goods or services related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered.

deliveryLocations.title: Delivery Locations
deliveryLocations.description: The locations where activity related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered.

relatedLot.title: Related lot
relatedLot.description: The identifier of the lot to which this item relates.

activeIngredients.title: Active ingredients
activeIngredients.description: The active ingredients, typically chemical compounds or biological substances.

dosageForm.title: Dosage form
