dosageForm.description: The dosage form in which the medicine is available, from the dosageForm codelist.

administrationRoute.title: Administration route
administrationRoute.description: The route by which the medicine can be administered, from the administrationRoute codelist.

immediateContainer.title: Immediate container
immediateContainer.description: The immediate container for the medicine. Also known as: presentation, presentation form, package.

valueBreakdown.title: Value breakdown
valueBreakdown.description: Information about the value breakdown of the item value, such as applied discounts and charges. It is used at item level when there is no information at unit level.

deliveryDate.title: Delivery Date
deliveryDate.description: Period during which the item should be delivered

id.description: An identifier for this amendment: often the amendment number
id.title: ID

description.description: A free text, or semi-structured, description of the changes made in this amendment.
description.title: Description

amendsReleaseID.description: Provide the identifier (release.id) of the OCDS release (from this contracting process) that provides the values for this contracting process **before** the amendment was made.
amendsReleaseID.title: Amended release (identifier)

releaseID.description: Provide the identifier (release.id) of the OCDS release (from this contracting process) that provides the values for this contracting process **after** the amendment was made.
releaseID.title: Amending release (identifier)

changes.title: Amended fields
changes.description: An array of change objects describing the fields changed, and their former values. (Deprecated in 1.1)

property.title: Property
property.description: The property name that has been changed relative to the place the amendment is. For example if the contract value has changed, then the property under changes within the contract.amendment would be value.amount. (Deprecated in 1.1)

former_value.title: Former Value
former_value.description: The previous value of the changed property, in whatever type the property is. (Deprecated in 1.1)

deprecated.description: A free-text or semi-structured string describing the changes made in each amendment can be provided in the amendment.description field. To provide structured information on the fields that have changed, publishers should provide releases indicating the state of the contracting process before and after the amendment.

originalValue.title: Additional Amendment Details
originalValue.description: Additional Details of what has change for this Amendment

amendedValue.title: Additional Amendment Details
amendedValue.description: Additional Details of what has change for this Amendment

amendsPeriod.title: Amends Period
amendsPeriod.description: If the amendment is made to modify the contract duration, then they new duration should be registered in this field

amendsAmount.title: Amends Amount
amendsAmount.description: If the amendment is made to up the contract amount, that additional amount should be registered is this field

financialCode.title: Financial Code
financialCode.description: The financial code that approves this amendment if applies.

guarantee.title: Guarantee
guarantee.description: The guarantee related to this amendment

prepaid.title: Was this amendment prepaid? Only used when the amendment is a cancellation
prepaid.description: A true/false field to indicate whether the item was prepaid

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this amendment relates.

unstructuredChanges.title: Unstructured changes
unstructuredChanges.description: Unstructured or semi-structured changes to an earlier notice.

Classification.title: Classification
Classification.description: A classification consists of at least two parts: an identifier for the list (scheme) from which the classification is taken, and an identifier for the category from that list being applied. It is useful to also publish a text label and/or URI that users can draw on to interpret the classification.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme or codelist from which the classification code is taken. For line item classifications, this uses the open [itemClassificationScheme](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) codelist.

id.title: ID
id.description: The classification code taken from the scheme.

description.title: Description
description.description: A textual description or title for the classification code.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to uniquely identify the classification code.

Identifier.title: Identifier
Identifier.description: A unique identifier for a party (organization).

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: Organization identifiers should be taken from an existing organization identifier list. The scheme field is used to indicate the list or register from which the identifier is taken. This value should be taken from the [Organization Identifier Scheme](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#organization-identifier-scheme) codelist.

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier of the organization in the selected scheme.

legalName.title: Legal Name
legalName.description: The legally registered name of the organization.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to identify the organization, such as those provided by [Open Corporates](http://www.opencorporates.com) or some other relevant URI provider. This is not for listing the website of the organization: that can be done through the URL field of the Organization contact point.

schemeURL.title: Scheme Url
schemeURL.description: A url to more with human-readable information about the scheme used

legalPersonality.title: Legal personality
legalPersonality.description: Specify the legal personality of the party who participates in this contracting process. Using the [legalPersonality](https://github.com/INAImexico/ocds_nameBreakdown_extension/blob/master/codelists/legalPersonality.csv) codelist.

givenName.title: Given name
givenName.description: The given name of the natural person.

patronymicName.title: Patronymic name
patronymicName.description: The patronymic name of the natural person. This could be used to capture the common surname of a natural person or the first surname for hispanic countries (usually the father's surname).

matronymicName.title: Matronymic name
matronymicName.description: The matronymic name of the natural person. This is for the second surname in hispanic countries (usually the mother's surname).

streetAddress.title: Street address
streetAddress.description: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.

locality.title: Locality
locality.description: The locality. For example, Mountain View.

countryName.title: Country name
countryName.description: The country name. For example, United States.

country.title: Country code
country.description: The country, from the closed country codelist. If a country is missing, [create an issue](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues) to discuss the addition of a user-assigned code to the country codelist.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the address.

ContactPoint.title: Contact point
ContactPoint.description: A person, contact point or department to contact in relation to this contracting process.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the contact person, department, or contact point, for correspondence relating to this contracting process.

email.title: Email
email.description: The e-mail address of the contact point/person.

telephone.title: Telephone
telephone.description: The telephone number of the contact point/person. This should include the international dialing code.

faxNumber.title: Fax number
faxNumber.description: The fax number of the contact point/person. This should include the international dialing code.

url.title: URL
url.description: A web address for the contact point/person.

type.title: Contact point type
type.description: Specify the contact point type using the [contactPointType] (https://github.com/INAImexico/ocds_contactPointType_extension/blob/master/codelists/contactPointType.csv) codelist.

availableLanguages.title: Available Language(s)
availableLanguages.description: An array of language codes (e.g. en, es, uk)

givenName.title: Given name
givenName.description: The given name of the natural person.

patronymicName.title: Patronymic name
patronymicName.description: The patronymic name of the natural person. This could be used to capture the common surname of a natural person or the first surname for hispanic countries (usually the father's surname).

matronymicName.title: Matronymic name
matronymicName.description: The matronymic name of the natural person. This is for the second surname in hispanic countries (usually the mother's surname).

availableLanguage.title: Available languages
availableLanguage.description: The languages the contact point operates in, using either two-letter [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of lowercase two-letter codes from [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is strongly recommended unless there is a clear user need for distinguishing the language subtype.

address.title: Address
address.description: The address of the contact point.

Value.title: Value
Value.description: Financial values and currency for the certificate.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency for each amount should always be specified using the uppercase 3-letter currency code from ISO4217.

currencyName.title: Currency Name
currencyName.description: The currency name of the financial value

netAmount.title: Net amount
netAmount.description: Amount as a number, without taxes.

altAmount.title: Alternative Amount
altAmount.description: The Amount on the alternative currency.

altCurrency.title: Currency
altCurrency.description: The currency for each amount should always be specified using the uppercase 3-letter currency code from ISO4217.

exchangeRate.title: Exchange Rate
exchangeRate.description: The convertion between amount and altAmount on the exchange rate date

exchangeRateDate.title: Exchange Rate Date
exchangeRateDate.description: The date of this exchange rate was applied.

exchangeRates.title: Exchange rates
exchangeRates.description: Used to specify any exchange rates used, or to be used, to convert from amount to an alternative currency. To include alternative currency values within the data itself, add an 'amount_CODE' field alongside amount (e.g. amount_USD). See the extension documentation for more details.

valueAddedTaxIncluded.title: Tax Included
valueAddedTaxIncluded.description: A Yes/No field to indicate whether the value tax was included

Period.title: Period
Period.description: Key events during a contracting process may have a known start date, end date, duration, or maximum extent (the latest date the period can extend to). In some cases, not all of these fields will have known or relevant values.

startDate.title: Start date
startDate.description: The start date for the period. When known, a precise start date must be provided.

endDate.title: End date
endDate.description: The end date for the period. When known, a precise end date must be provided.

maxExtentDate.description: The period cannot be extended beyond this date. This field can be used to express the maximum available date for extension or renewal of this period.
maxExtentDate.title: Maximum extent

durationInDays.description: The maximum duration of this period in days. A user interface can collect or display this data in months or years as appropriate, and then convert it into days when storing this field. This field can be used when exact dates are not known. If a startDate and endDate are set, this field, if used, should be equal to the difference between startDate and endDate. Otherwise, if a startDate and maxExtentDate are set, this field, if used, should be equal to the difference between startDate and maxExtentDate.
durationInDays.title: Duration (days)

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the period.

RelatedProcess.description: A reference to a related contracting process: generally one preceding or following on from the current process.
RelatedProcess.title: Related Process

id.title: Relationship ID
id.description: A local identifier for this relationship, unique within this array.

relationship.description: The type of relationship, using the open [relatedProcess](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#related-process) codelist.
relationship.title: Relationship

title.description: The title of the related process, where referencing an open contracting process, this field should match the tender/title field in the related process.
title.title: Related process title

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The identification scheme used by this cross-reference, using the open [relatedProcessScheme](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/codelists/#related-process-scheme) codelist.

identifier.description: The identifier of the related process. If the scheme is 'ocid', this must be an Open Contracting ID (ocid).
identifier.title: Identifier

uri.description: A URI pointing to a machine-readable document, release or record package containing the identified related process.
uri.title: Related process URI

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots in the related process to which this process relates.

BidsStatistic.title: Bid Statistic
BidsStatistic.description: For reporting aggregate statistics about the bids related to a tender. Where lots are in use, statistics can be broken down by lot.

id.title: ID
id.description: An internal identifier for this statistic.

measure.title: Measure
measure.description: The statistic reported in the value.

date.title: Date
date.description: The date when this statistic was last updated. This is often the closing date of the tender process. This field may be omitted unless either (a) the same statistic is provided from multiple points in time, or (b) there is a specific local requirement for the date when statistics were calculated to be provided.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value for the measure in question. Total counts should be provided as an integer. Percentages should be provided as a proportion of 1 (e.g. 10% = 0.1)

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any notes needed to understand or interpret the given statistic.

relatedLot.title: Related Lot
relatedLot.description: Where lots are in use, if this statistic relates to bids on a particular lot, provide the lot identifier here. If left blank, the statistic will be interpreted as applying to the whole tender.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency of the amount in the `value` field, if the statistic has a monetary value.

Bids.title: Bids
Bids.description: Summary and detailed information about bids received and evaluated as part of this contracting process.

statistics.title: Statistics
statistics.description: Summary statistics on the number and nature of bids received. Where information is provided on individual bids, these statistics should match those that can be calculated from the bid details array.

details.title: Bid details
details.description: An array of bids, providing information on the bidders, and where applicable, bid status, bid values and related documents. The extent to which this information can be disclosed varies from jurisdiction to jurisdiction.

Bid.title: Bid
Bid.description: For representing a bid in response to the tender or qualification stage in this contracting process.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier for this bid

date.title: Date
date.description: The date when this bid was received.

tenderers.title: Tenderer
tenderers.description: The party, or parties, responsible for this bid.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total value of the bid.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the bid and its evaluation.

requirementResponses.title: Requirement responses
requirementResponses.description: The responses of this bid to the requirements.

relatedRound.description: The round in which these bids were made
relatedRound.title: Related Round

items.title: Items offered by the tenderer(s)
items.description: The goods, works or services offered by the tenderer(s), broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but the quantity specified instead.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: Identifiers for this bid or expression of interest. This field can be used to provide internal identifiers for the submission, such as identifiers from a buyer's document management system or procurement system.

submissionType.title: Submission type
submissionType.description: The type of the submission, using the closed [submissionType](https://github.com/open-contracting-extensions/ocds_bid_extension/blob/master/codelists/submissionType.csv) codelist.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the bid or expression of interest. The description field may be used to describe the terms and conditions for the submission.

validityPeriod.title: Validity period
validityPeriod.description: The period for which the bid or expression of interest is valid.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: If this bid relates to one or more specific lots, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.
relatedLots.NOTE: Compare against lotValues approach in open procurement API - http://api-docs.openprocurement.org/en/latest/lots.html

countriesOfOrigin.title: Countries of origin
countriesOfOrigin.description: The countries of origin of the items in the bid or expression of interest, from the closed country codelist. If a country is missing, [create an issue](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues) to discuss the addition of a user-assigned code to the country codelist.

rank.title: Rank
rank.description: The position of the bid (i.e. whether the bid is ranked first, second, third, etc.) in a design contest, a framework agreement with multiple winners (e.g. cascades), an innovation partnership, a competitive dialogue, or another procedure.

variant.title: Is variant
variant.description: Whether the bid is a variant. A variant is a bid that fulfills the buyer's needs differently than as proposed in the procurement documents.

hasSubcontracting.title: Subcontracting involved
hasSubcontracting.description: Whether a part of the contract will be subcontracted to third parties.

subcontracting.title: Subcontracting
subcontracting.description: Information about the parts of the contract that will be subcontracted to third parties.

foreignSubsidyMeasures.title: Foreign subsidy measures
foreignSubsidyMeasures.description: The measures applied under the Foreign Subsidies Regulation (EU) 2022/2560.

participationUrl.title: Participation url
participationUrl.description: A link for participation in auction

selfEligible.title: Self eligible
selfEligible.description: Confirms compliance of eligibility criteria set by the customer in the tendering documents

eligibilityDocuments.title: Eligibility documents
eligibilityDocuments.description: Documents related to eligibility of bids

selfQualified.title: Self qualified
selfQualified.description: Confirms the absence of grounds for refusal to participate in accordance with Article 17 of the Law of Ukraine "On public procurement"

BudgetBreakdown.title: Detailed budget breakdown
BudgetBreakdown.description: This section allows a detailed budget breakdown to be expressed, covering multiple budget sources and multiple periods

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier for this particular budget entry.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short free text description of this budget entry.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The value of the budget line item. A positive amount means the source organization funds a future contracting process. A negative amount means a future contracting process pays the source organization.

uri.title: Linked budget information
uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a machine-readable information about this budget entry.

period.title: Budget period
period.description: The period covered by this budget entry.

sourceParty.title: Source organization
sourceParty.description: The organization providing the funds for this budget entry. The corresponding entry in the `parties` array must have 'sourceParty' in its `roles` array.

budgetLines.title: Budget lines
budgetLines.description: A list of the budget lines associated to this party.

fundType.title: Budget fund type
fundType.description: Description of the budget fund type.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the certificate of budgetary availability.

classifications.title: Budget classifications
classifications.description: Budget classifications must be provided as a set of key-value pairs, where the key is a dimension (or the label of a dimension) used in budget classification, and the value is the value of that dimension for this contracting process or specific contract (depending on the point within an OCDS file at which the classification is provided).

measures.title: measures
measures.description: Measures must be provided as a set of key-value pairs, where the key should be the name of the measure used within a related Fiscal Data Package dataset or other budget and spending dataset. The value is the value of this measure when last updated, and must be provided as a number in the same default currency as any aggregate reported budget or spending figures.

Charge.title: Charge
Charge.description: A charge to be incurred by users or government over the course of the contract. Charge information can be broken down by period. Information on the unit prices upon which total values are based can be provided in the tariffs section.

id.title: Charge identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this specific charge. This field is used to keep track of revisions of a charge across multiple OCDS releases.

title.title: Charge title
title.description: A descriptive title for this charge.

paidBy.title: Paid by
paidBy.description: Is this a user charge (paid by businesses or citizens using the facilities provided by the contract), or a charge paid by the government?

period.title: Period
period.description: The period to which this charge applies.

estimatedValue.title: Estimated value
estimatedValue.description: What is the estimated total value to be raised from this charge during this period.

actualValue.title: Actual value
actualValue.description: In the implementation section, this field may be updated with the total revenue raised from this charge during this period.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any notes on this charge. This may include clarifying information.

Finance.title: Financing arrangement
Finance.description: An arrangement between two parties for raising money.

id.title: ID
id.description: An identifier for this financing arrangement.

title.title: Title
title.description: A short title for this financing arrangement.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of this financing arrangement. This may include details of service fees, commitment fees, lender rights, step in arrangements, exchange rate guarantees, and for syndicated loans, details of syndication and any members of the syndicate.

financingParty.title: Financing organization
financingParty.description: The organization providing this financing arrangement.

financeType.title: Finance type
financeType.description: The type of finance arranged, from the finance type codelist.

financeCategory.title: Finance category
financeCategory.description: For categorizing the nature of any financial investment. This field must be filled in for debt finance. This information can be used to identify the order of preference for investors to get their money back in cases of liquidation.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total value of this finance.

period.title: Finance period
period.description: The period covered by this financing arrangement. Also called maturity.

interestRate.title: Interest rate
interestRate.description: The interest rate associated with this finance.

base.title: Base
base.description: The variable to which an additional margin amount is added to get the interest amount. This can be specified as a fixed number, as a known variable (e.g. LIBOR or LIBOR+1%), or can be omitted if margin specifies the entire interest rate.

margin.title: Margin
margin.description: The variable added to the base to give the interest amount, expressed as a decimal (for example, 0.1) and not as a percentage (for example, 10).

fixed.title: Fixed rate
fixed.description: A boolean field. If this interest rate of fixed, set to true. Otherwise, set to false.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any explanatory notes concerning the interest rate.

repaymentFrequency.title: Repayment frequency (days)
repaymentFrequency.description: What is the average repayment frequency (in days) for this source of finance. For example, for yearly, use 365; for monthly repayment use 30.4; for daily use 1. User interfaces may wish to translate this into a more user-friendly presentation, such as 'daily','monthly' or 'yearly'.

stepInRights.title: Step in rights
stepInRights.description: Whether provision of this finance confers any step in rights to the financing organization.

exchangeRateGuarantee.title: Exchange rate guarantees
exchangeRateGuarantee.description: Whether there is an associated exchange rate guarantee with this source of finance.

financingPartyType.title: Financing organization type
financingPartyType.description: The type of the financing organization, from the closed financingPartyType codelist.

source.title: Funding source
source.description: The source of funds for this financing arrangement. For example, the Green Climate Fund.

assetClass.title: Asset class
assetClass.description: The asset classes used in this financing arrangement, from the closed assetClass codelist.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of this financing arrangement, from the closed financingArrangementType codelist.

repaymentPriority.title: Repayment priority
repaymentPriority.description: The order in which the debt in this financing arrangement will be repaid in case of default, from the closed debtRepaymentPriority codelist.

concessional.title: Concessional
concessional.description: Whether this financing arrangement is provided below market rate in order to accelerate climate or development objectives. Also called soft financing and subsidized funding.

resultsBased.title: Results based
resultsBased.description: Whether payments under this financing arrangement are contingent on the achievement of pre-defined results.

paymentPeriod.title: Payment period
paymentPeriod.description: The period over which the borrower in this financing arrangement is obliged to make payments.

paymentFrequency.title: Payment frequency (days)
paymentFrequency.description: The average payment frequency (in days) of this financing arrangement. For example, 365 for yearly, 30.4 for monthly, or 1 for daily.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this financing arrangement relates.

description.title: Description
description.description: A name or description of this location. This might include the name(s) of the location(s), or might provide a human-readable description of the location to be covered.

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: We follow the [GeoJSON standard](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7946) to express basic location information, using longitude, latitude, and optional elevation values in the [WGS84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System) (EPSG:4326) projection. A point location can be identified by geocoding an address. For concession licenses, or other scenarios covering a polygon location that is not contained in a known gazetteer, polygon and multi-polygon can be used.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of [GeoJSON Geometry Objects](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7946#section-3.1) being provided. To provide longitude, latitude, and optional elevation, use 'Point', and enter an array of [longitude, latitude] or [longitude, latitude, elevation] as the value of the coordinates field: e.g. [-122.085, 37.42].

coordinates.title: Coordinates
coordinates.description: The relevant array of points, e.g. [longitude, latitude] or [longitude, latitude, elevation], or a nested array of points, for the GeoJSON geometry being described. The longitude and latitude must be expressed in decimal degrees in the WGS84 (EPSG:4326) projection.

geometry.notes_for_guidance: The guidance notes should describe when to use MultiPoint, and when to use multiple line-items each with their own locations

gazetteer.title: Gazetteer
gazetteer.description: Identifiers from a gazetteer (a geographical index or directory) for the location.

scheme.title: Gazetteer scheme
scheme.description: The identifier of the gazetteer. The `locationGazetteers.csv` codelist provides details of services, where available, that can resolve a gazetteer entry to provide location names.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: An array of one or more codes drawn from the gazetteer indicated by the `scheme` field.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to a further description of the location. This might be a human-readable document with information on the location, or a machine-readable description of the location.

Metric.title: Metric
Metric.description: Metrics are used to set out targets and results from a contracting process. During the planning and tender sections, a metric indicates the anticipated results. In award and contract sections it indicates the awarded/contracted results. In the implementation section it is used to provide updates on actually delivered results, also known as outputs.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier for this metric. In some cases this may be drawn from a codelist of metrics required for this type of contracting process, or in other instances may be an arbitrary identifier.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of the metric. This may include short details of measurement methods.

observations.title: Observations
observations.description: An array of target or actual values for this metric.

Observation.title: Observation
Observation.description: An actual or target observation. Observations should include either a value (for financial metrics) or measure (for other metrics).

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this specific observation. This may be an arbitrary identifier, or could be a composite of the metric identifier, and the date and other dimensions of this observation.

period.title: Period
period.description: The period over which this observation is measured.

value.title: Value
value.description: For financial metrics, the value of this forecast, target or actual observation.

measure.title: Measure
measure.description: For non-financial metrics, the measure of this forecast, target or actual observation. Measures may be provided as free text or numerical values.

name.title: Unit name
name.description: The name of the unit.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The list from which units of measure identifiers are taken. It is recommended to use the scheme 'UNCEFACT' and codes from the UN/CEFACT Recommendation 20 list of "Codes for Units of Measure Used in International Trade".

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier from the codelist referenced in the scheme field. For example, with UNCEFACT, this is the value of the 'Common Code' column. From this identifier, applications can look-up the human readable name or symbol for this unit of measure.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: If the scheme used provide a machine-readable URI for this unit of measure, this can be given.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: Any number of dimensions can be recorded within this object. Dimensions names should follow the camelCase conventions of OCDS.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any notes on this observation. This may include clarifying information.

relatedImplementationMilestone.title: Related implementation milestone
relatedImplementationMilestone.description: A link to the milestone in the implementation section of OCDS to which this forecast, target or actual observation relates.

MilestoneReference.title: Milestone Reference
MilestoneReference.description: A block used to reference a milestone, including the ID and title of the milestone being referenced.

id.title: Milestone ID
id.description: The ID of the milestone being referenced, this must match the ID of a milestone described elsewhere in a release about this contracting process.

title.title: Milestone title
title.description: The title of the milestone being referenced, this must match the title of a milestone described elsewhere in a release about this contracting process.

PerformanceFailure.title: Performance failure disclosure
PerformanceFailure.description: Details of the performance failures for a given period and category. Details of the associated penalties and abatements provided for in the contract, imposed and paid can also be provided.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this specific category and period of performance failure. This field is used to keep track of revisions of a charge across multiple OCDS releases.

period.title: Performance failure period
period.description: The reporting period for the performance failures.

category.title: Performance failure category
category.description: The category of the performance failures.

events.title: Number of events
events.description: The number of performance failures for this period and category.

penaltyContracted.title: Contracted penalty
penaltyContracted.description: A description of the penalty or abatement provided for in the contract for this period, category and number of performance failures.

penaltyImposed.title: Penalty imposed
penaltyImposed.description: A description of the penalty or abatement imposed for this period, category and number of performance failures.

penaltyPaid.title: Penalty paid
penaltyPaid.description: Whether the penalty imposed for this period, category and number of performance failures has been paid.

PreQualification.title: Pre-qualification
PreQualification.description: Data regarding pre-qualification process - limiting the number of qualified bidders by reviewing each bidder's qualifications against a set of criteria.

id.title: Pre-qualification ID
id.description: An identifier for this pre-qualification process. This may be the same as the ocid, or may be drawn from an internally held identifier for this process.

description.title: Pre-qualification description
description.description: Pre-qualification description

status.title: Pre-qualification status
status.description: The current status of the pre-qualification.

submissionMethod.title: Submission method
submissionMethod.description: The methods by which bids are submitted.

submissionMethodDetails.title: Submission method details
submissionMethodDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the submission method. This may include the address, e-mail address or online service to which bids should be submitted, and any special requirements to be followed for submissions.

period.title: Pre-qualification period
period.description: The period when the pre-qualification is open for submissions. The end date is the closing date for pre-qualification submissions.

enquiryPeriod.title: Enquiry period
enquiryPeriod.description: The period during which enquiries regarding the pre-qualification may be made and answered.

hasEnquiries.title: Has enquiries?
hasEnquiries.description: A true/false field to indicate whether any enquiries were received during the pre-qualification process

eligibilityCriteria.title: Eligibility criteria
eligibilityCriteria.description: A description of any eligibility criteria for bidders to participate in the pre-qualification.

qualificationPeriod.title: Qualification period
qualificationPeriod.description: The date or period when candidates will are anticipated to be qualified or pre-selected (shortlisted).

numberOfTenderers.title: Number of tenderers
numberOfTenderers.description: The number of entities who submit a response to the pre-qualification.

tenderers.title: Tenderers
tenderers.description: All entities who submit a response to the pre-qualification.

procuringEntity.title: Procuring entity
procuringEntity.description: The entity managing the procurement, which may be different from the buyer who is paying / using the items being procured.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the pre-qualification, including any notices. See the `documentType.csv` codelist for details of potential documents to include.

milestones.title: Milestones
milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the pre-qualification.

amendments.description: An amendment is a formal change to the pre-qualification process, and generally involves the publication of a new RFQ notice/release. The rationale and a description of the changes made can be provided here.
amendments.title: Amendments

Criterion.title: Criterion
Criterion.description: A criterion on which bids, tenderers, lots or items will be judged, evaluated or assessed.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this criterion. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](https://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this criterion.

source.title: Source
source.description: Source of response to the requirements specified in the criterion, for example responses may be submitted by tenderers or by an assessment committee at the procuringEntity.

relatesTo.title: Related schema element
relatesTo.description: The schema element that the criterion judges, evaluates or assesses. For example criterion may be defined against items or against bidders.

relatedItem.title: Related item
relatedItem.description: The identifier of the item in the tender section to which this criterion applies.

requirementGroups.title: Requirement groups
requirementGroups.description: A list of requirement groups for this Criterion. A criterion is satisfied by one or more requirement groups being met. A requirement group is met when all requirements in the group are satisfied.

relatesToTenderer.title: Relates to tenderer
relatesToTenderer.description: The criterion judges, evaluates or assesses a tenderer.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this criterion applies.

RequirementGroup.title: Requirement group
RequirementGroup.description: A requirement group is a set of requirements that must be fulfilled together to validate a criterion.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this requirement group. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](https://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this requirement group.

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: A list requirements which must all be satisfied for the requirement group to be met.

Requirement.title: Requirement
Requirement.description: An atomic requirement. Requirements can specify the expected value that the response has to contain, or a range of threshold values within which the response has to fit in. The requirement may apply to a certain period of time.

id.title: Requirement identifier
id.description: The identifier for this requirement. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](https://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

title.title: Requirement title
title.description: The title of this atomic requirement.

description.title: Requirement description
description.description: A free text description for this atomic requirement.

dataType.title: Requirement datatype
dataType.description: The data type in which the response must be provided.

pattern.title: Response validation pattern
pattern.description: A regular expression with which to validate the response.

expectedValue.title: Expected value
expectedValue.description: The expected value of the requirement, when the response must be specific value.

minValue.title: Minimum value
minValue.description: The lower bound of the requirement, when the response must be within a certain range.

maxValue.title: Maximum value
maxValue.description: The upper bound of the requirement, when the response must be within a certain range.

period.title: Period
period.description: The period to which the requirement applies: for example, the tenderer's turnover in a given year.

RequirementResponse.title: Requirement response
RequirementResponse.description: An assertion that responds to a single requirement. A response provides the value for the requirement and may provide the period to which it applies.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: The unique identifier of this response in the context of the contracting process.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of this response.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of this response.

period.title: Period
period.description: The period to which the response applies.

requirement.title: Related requirement
requirement.description: A reference to the requirement to which the response applies.

relatedTenderer.title: Related tenderer
relatedTenderer.description: Where this requirement response relates to a tenderer and is provided by the buyer or procuring entity this field should be used to reference the entry in the parties section for the tenderer the response relates to.

id.title: Requirement ID
id.description: The identifier of the requirement to which the response applies.

title.title: Requirement title
title.description: The title of the requirement to which the response applies.

Risk.title: Risk
Risk.description: A risk relating to the project.

id.title: Risk ID
id.description: A local identifier for this risk, unique within this block. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a risk through the compilation from release to record mechanism.

category.title: Risk category
category.description: The category of the risk, from the riskCategory codelist.

description.title: Risk description
description.description: The description of the risk.

allocation.title: Risk allocation
allocation.description: The party to the contract that retains the risk.

notes.title: Risk notes
notes.description: Additional notes on the risk, for example the rationale for the allocation.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier for this shareholding, unique within this array.

shareholding.title: Shareholding
shareholding.description: The proportion of the organization's shares held by the shareholder, expressed as a decimal between 0 and 1.

votingRights.title: Voting rights
votingRights.description: The type of voting rights associated with the shareholder's shares.

votingRightsDetails.title: Voting rights details
votingRightsDetails.description: Detailed information about the voting rights associated with the shareholder's shares: for example, when the shareholder voting rights are restricted, additional or enhanced.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Additional notes on the shareholding or shareholder: for example, details on any caps on equity transfer, or lock-in arrangements, applicable to the shareholder.

Tariff.title: Tariff
Tariff.description: An item in a tariff table, setting out a breakdown of the user or government fees payable in relation to each unit of a particular good or services.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this specific tariff. This field is used to keep track of revisions of a tariff across multiple OCDS releases.

paidBy.title: Paid by
paidBy.description: Is this a user charge (paid by businesses or citizens using the facilities provided by the contract), or a charge paid by the government?

period.title: Period
period.description: The period to which this tariff applies.

value.title: Value
value.description: The price per unit of this tariff.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: The unit against which this tariff is charged.

name.title: Unit name
name.description: The name of the unit that the tariff is charged against. E.g. tonnes,

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The list from which units of measure identifiers are taken. It is recommended to use the scheme 'UNCEFACT' and codes from the UN/CEFACT Recommendation 20 list of "Codes for Units of Measure Used in International Trade".

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier from the codelist referenced in the schema property. For example, with UNCEFACT, this is the value of the 'Common Code' column. From this identifier, applications can look-up the human readable name or symbol for this unit of measure.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: If the scheme used provide a machine-readable URI for this unit of measure, this can be given.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: Used to capture the different breakdowns in tariff charges. Any number of dimensions can be recorded within this object. Dimensions names should follow the camelCase conventions of OCDS.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any notes on this tariff line item. This may include clarifying information.

EvaluationIndicators.title: Evaluation indicators
EvaluationIndicators.description: Key indicators that describe how the PPP option has been evaluated by government.

riskPremium.title: Risk premium
riskPremium.description: The risk premium used by government when evaluating the PPP option, expressed as a decimal (for example, 0.1) and not as a percentage (for example, 10).

riskPremiumDetails.title: Risk premium details
riskPremiumDetails.description: Additional details on the risk premium used: for example, the rationale.

discountRate.title: Discount rate
discountRate.description: The discount rate used by government when evaluating the PPP option, expressed as a decimal (for example, 0.1) and not as a percentage (for example, 10).

discountRateDetails.title: Discount rate details
discountRateDetails.description: Additional details on the discount rate used.

netPresentValue.title: Net present value
netPresentValue.description: The discounted value of an investment's cash inflows minus the discounted value of its cash outflows.

netPresentValueDetails.title: Net present value details
netPresentValueDetails.description: Additional details on the calculation of the net present value.

FinanceSummary.title: Finance summary
FinanceSummary.description: Key indicators that describe the financial model of the PPP.

debtEquityRatio.title: Debt-equity ratio
debtEquityRatio.description: The debt-equity ratio of the project, expressed as a decimal (for example, 0.1). Also called gearing or leverage.

debtEquityRatioDetails.title: Debt-equity ratio details
debtEquityRatioDetails.description: Additional details on the calculation of the debt equity ratio.

shareCapital.title: Share capital
shareCapital.description: The value of the capital in the project that comes from the issue of shares.

shareCapitalDetails.title: Share capital details
shareCapitalDetails.description: Additional details on the calculation of the share capital.

subsidyRatio.title: Subsidy ratio
subsidyRatio.description: The subsidy's proportion of the project value, expressed as a decimal between 0 and 1.

subsidyRatioDetails.title: Subsidy ratio details
subsidyRatioDetails.description: Additional details on the calculation of the subsidy ratio.

projectIRR.title: Internal rate of return
projectIRR.description: The internal rate of return of the project, expressed as a decimal (for example, 0.1) and not as a percentage (for example, 10).

projectIRRDetails.title: Internal rate of return details
projectIRRDetails.description: Additional details on the calculation of the project IRR.

Source.title: Source
Source.description: An information system from which data originates.

id.title: ID
id.description: The locally unique identifier for the source.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the source.

url.title: URL
url.description: The web address of the source.

id.title: ID
id.description: An identifier for this data segment.

criteria.title: The criteria.
criteria.description: The criteria for this data segment.

Round.title: Auction Stage Round
Round.description: Information about a round during an auction stage

id.title: Round ID
id.description: An identifier for this round.

period.title: Round period
period.description: The period when the round is open for submissions.

Stage.title: Auction Stage
Stage.description: Information about a stage during an auction.

id.title: Stage ID
id.description: An identifier for this stage.

rounds.title: Rounds
rounds.description: All the rounds within the stage

bids.title: Bids
bids.description: All the bids who are made during this stage

Auction.title: Auction
Auction.description: Auction object which shows all auction properties of lots and tender

id.title: Auction ID
id.description: An identifier for this auction.

relatedLot.title: Auction related lot
relatedLot.description: The reference of the lot id that is being auctioned in the auction

winningBids.title: Winning Bids
winningBids.description: The best bids made during all the stages, selected as the winners of the auction.

period.title: Auction Period
period.description: Period when Auction is conducted

Beneficiary.title: Beneficiary
Beneficiary.description: The information related to the beneficiary of a good or service.

id.title: Beneficiary Id
id.description: The identifier for this beneciary

benefit.title: Benefit
benefit.description: The benefit that the beneciary will have from the good or service.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of this particular entry.

executed.title: Was the guarantee executed?
executed.description: Field to indicate if the guarantee was executed or not

id.title: Guarantee ID
id.description: A local identifier for this guarantee, unique within this block.

type.title: Guarantee type
type.description: Specify the guarantee type for this contract using the [guaranteeType](https://github.com/contratacionesabiertas/ocds_guarantees_extension/blob/master/codelists/guaranteeType.csv) codelist.

date.title: Guarantee date
date.description: The date of the guarantee. This is the date on which the guarantee is issued.

obligations.title: Guaranteed obligations
obligations.description: Specify the type of obligations that are guaranteed, using the [obligationType](https://github.com/contratacionesabiertas/ocds_guarantees_extension/blob/master/codelists/guaranteedObligations.csv) codelist.

value.title: Guarantee value
value.description: Total amount of the guarantee.

period.title: Guarantee period
period.description: The period on which this quote is valid.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Amount of the guarantee as a number

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Currency of the guarantee in a 3-letter ISO 4217 format.

Guarantee.title: Guarantee
Guarantee.description: A sum of money which the Economic Operator  may set out in tender documentation and which the Participant (Award of Tender/Lot) shall pay in case of a refusal to sign the Contract, or in other cases foreseen in the Law.

financialCode.title: Financial Code
financialCode.description: The financial code that approves this breakdown.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier for this particular financial progress breakdown entry.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short free text description of this financial progress breakdown. This may be displayed in user interfaces to help users interpret this entry. This may be automatically generated from structured data or may be manually entered.

period.title: Budget period
period.description: The period covered by this financial progress breakdown entry. This information may also be duplicated using classifications where relevant.

classifications.title: Budget classifications
classifications.description: Budget classifications must be provided as a set of key-value pairs, where the key is a dimension (or the label of a dimension) used in budget classification, and the value is the value of that dimension for this contracting process or specific contract (depending on the point within an OCDS file at which the classification is provided).

measures.title: measures
measures.description: Measures must be provided as a set of key-value pairs, where the key should be the name of the measure used within a related Fiscal Data Package dataset or other budget and spending dataset. The value is the value of this measure when last updated, and must be provided as a number in the same default currency as any aggregate reported budget or spending figures.

FinancialProgressBreakdown.title: Financial progress breakdown
FinancialProgressBreakdown.description: This section allows a detailed breakdown of financial progress to be provided, each covering a particular periods, or allocating financial progress against particular funding sources and fiscal classifications.

PurchaseOrder.title: Purchase Order
PurchaseOrder.description: Information regarding the purchase orders made in the implementation of a contract.

id.title: Purchase Order ID
id.description: The identifier for this purchase order. It must be unique and must not change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](https://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

status.title: Purchase order status
status.description: The current status of the purchase order

executionPeriod.title: Period
executionPeriod.description: The start and end date for the purchase order excecution.

Attribute.title: Attribute
Attribute.description: An attribute, including its name and value.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the attribute, such as 'brand', 'manufacturer', and similar.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of the attribute.

id.title: Id
id.description: A local identifier for the attribute.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier to reference and merge the subitems by. Must be unique within a given array of subitems.

description.title: Sub Item descripcion
description.description: Sub Item description

group.title: Group
group.description: A text that indicates if this sub item is grouped with others

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The number of units to be provided.

minQuantity.title: Minimum Quantity
minQuantity.description: The minimun number of units to be provided.

attributes.title: Item attributes
attributes.description: An array of attributes for the item

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: A description of the unit in which the supplies, services or works are provided (e.g. hours, kilograms) and the unit-price.

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier from the codelist referenced in the scheme property. Check the codelist for details of how to find and use identifiers from the scheme in use.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the unit.

value.title: Value
value.description: The monetary value of a single unit.

simultaneousSupply.title: Simultaneous Supply
simultaneousSupply.description: If this lot can be simultaneously supplied

statusDetails.title: Lot Status Details
statusDetails.description: The local name of the status of this lot

openContractType.title: Open Contract Type
openContractType.description: If this lot is open in amount or quantity

minValue.title: Minimum value
minValue.description: The estimated minimum value of the lot. A negative value indicates that the contracting process may involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

deliveryAddress.title: Lot Delivery Address
deliveryAddress.description: The address where this lot must be delivered.

awardCriteria.title: Award criteria
awardCriteria.description: Information about the award criteria for the lot.

bidOpening.title: Bid opening
bidOpening.description: The date, time, place and other details of the public bid opening.

communication.title: Communication
communication.description: Modalities of communication about key events for this lot.

contractTerms.title: Contract terms
contractTerms.description: Information about the terms governing the future contracts for the lot.

coveredBy.title: Covered by
coveredBy.description: The international legal instruments that the lot is covered by.

designContest.title: Design contest
designContest.description: Information about the organization of a design contest.

essentialAssets.title: Essential assets
essentialAssets.description: Information about the assets used for the provision of public services.

hasEssentialAssets.title: Has essential assets
hasEssentialAssets.description: Whether there is information about the assets used for the provision of public services.

awardPeriod.title: Award period
awardPeriod.description: The period for decision making regarding the contract award for the lot. The end date should be the date on which an award decision is due to be finalized. The start date may be used to indicate the start of an evaluation period.

hasAccessibilityCriteria.title: Has accessibility criteria
hasAccessibilityCriteria.description: Whether the technical specifications for the lot include accessibility criteria for people with disabilities.

noAccessibilityCriteriaRationale.title: No accessibility criteria rationale
noAccessibilityCriteriaRationale.description: The rationale for not including accessibility criteria when the object of the lot is intended for use by natural persons.

reviewDetails.title: Review details
reviewDetails.description: Precise information concerning the time limits for the review procedures for the lot or contact information from which it can be obtained.

id.title: Lot ID
id.description: A local identifier for this lot, such as a lot number. This is used in relatedLots references at the item, document and award level.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: Identifiers for this lot. This field can be used to provide internal identifiers for the lot, such as identifiers from a buyer's document management system or procurement system.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this lot.

status.title: Lot Status
status.description: The current status of the process related to this lot.

value.title: Lot value
value.description: The maximum estimated value of this lot.

tenderPeriod.title: Tender period
tenderPeriod.description: The period when this lot is open for submissions. The end date is the closing date for bid submissions.

contractPeriod.title: Contract period
contractPeriod.description: The period over which the contract is estimated or specified to be active. If the lot does not specify explicit dates, the duration field can be used.

buyer.title: Buyer
buyer.description: The organization aiming to conclude a contract with a supplier or to use the goods, works or services in this lot. This may be different from the procuring entity who may be specified in the tender data.

mainProcurementCategory.title: Main procurement category
mainProcurementCategory.description: The primary category describing the main object of this lot, using the closed procurementCategory codelist.

additionalProcurementCategories.title: Additional procurement categories
additionalProcurementCategories.description: Any additional categories describing the objects of this lot, using the open extendedProcurementCategory codelist.

enquiryPeriod.title: Enquiry period
enquiryPeriod.description: The period during which potential bidders may submit questions and requests for clarification about this lot to the buyer or the procuring entity.

submissionMethodDetails.title: Submission method details
submissionMethodDetails.description: Information about the methods by which bids are submitted for this lot. This can include the address, e-mail address or online service to which bids are submitted, and any special requirements to be followed for submissions. More structured information can be provided using the submission terms extension.

submissionTerms.title: Submission terms
submissionTerms.description: Information about the submission terms to describe how, when and where the tenderers need to submit their bids or expressions of interest for the lot.

hasOptions.title: Options used
hasOptions.description: Whether the buyer is expected to reserve the right to make additional purchases from the supplier.

otherRequirements.title: Other requirements
otherRequirements.description: Other requirements to participate in the lot.

recurrence.title: Recurrence
recurrence.description: Information on the recurrence of the lot.

hasRecurrence.title: Has recurrence
hasRecurrence.description: Whether the contracting process is recurrent.

hasRenewal.title: Has renewal
hasRenewal.description: Whether the buyer is expected to reserve the right to renew the future contract(s) related to the lot.

renewal.title: Renewal
renewal.description: The options for the renewal of the contract(s) related to the lot.

secondStage.title: Second stage
secondStage.description: Information about the second stage of a two-stage procedure (e.g. a restricted procedure, a competitive procedure with negotiation, a competitive dialogue or an innovation partnership).

selectionCriteria.title: Selection criteria
selectionCriteria.description: Information about the conditions for participation in a lot.

subcontractingTerms.title: Subcontracting terms
subcontractingTerms.description: Information about the terms governing subcontracting.

suitability.title: Suitability
suitability.description: Information about the suitability of the lot to different types of tenderers.

hasSustainability.title: Has sustainability
hasSustainability.description: Whether the lot incorporates Sustainable Public Procurement.

sustainability.title: Sustainability
sustainability.description: Information about how the lot incorporates Sustainable Public Procurement.

techniques.title: Techniques
techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

minimumValue.title: Minimum value
minimumValue.description: The estimated minimum value of the lot. A negative value indicates that the contracting process may involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

guarantee.title: Guarantee
guarantee.description: A sum of money which the Economic Operator  may set out in tender documentation and which the Participant (Award of Tender/Lot) shall pay in case of a refusal to sign the Contract, or in other cases foreseen in the Law.

pendingCancellation.title: Cancellation pending
pendingCancellation.description: Yes or No field showing  whether a lot is pending for cancellation.

Lot.title: Lots
Lot.description: A lot is a grouping of items within a tender that can be bid on or awarded together.

id.title: Investment Project Id
id.description: The identifier of the investment project to which this planning belongs

name.title: Investment Project Name
name.description: The name of the investment project to which this planning belongs

uri.title: Linked Investment Project information
uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a human-readable record about the investment project

id.title: Retention ID
id.description: The identifier for this retention.

name.title: Retention Name
name.description: Retention Name

Suitability.title: Suitability
Suitability.description: Information about the suitability of a contracting process, lot or lot group to different types of tenderers.

sme.title: Small and medium enterprises
sme.description: Whether the contracting process, lot or lot group is suitable to small and medium enterprises.

vcse.title: VCSE suitability
vcse.description: Suitable for voluntary, community and social enterprises (VCSE).

Measure.title: Measure
Measure.description: This section contain information about the measure of the budget line.

id.title: ID
id.description: ID to identify the specific accruing moment in which the budget's value will be expressed.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of the budget line item.

update.title: Period of updating
update.description: The period in which these measures are updated.

BudgetLine.title: Budget line
BudgetLine.description: This section contain detailed information about the budget line.

id.title: Budget line ID
id.description: An id for this budget line. This must be the concatenation of every code contained in the components array.

components.title: Components
components.description: A list of components that make up the identifier for this budget line.

measures.title: Measures
measures.description: A list of measures for this budget line.

name.description: The name of the component of this budget line using the [budgetClassificationsComponents](https://github.com/INAImexico/ocds_budgetClasifications_extension/blob/master/codelists/budgetClassificationComponents.csv) codelist.
name.title: Name

level.description: The hierarchy level of the component.
level.title: Level

code.description: A code to identify a specific value of the origin component.
code.title: Code

description.description: Description of the specific value of the component.
description.title: Description

Component.description: This section shows a component of the budget line.
Component.title: Budget line component

ClarificationMeeting.title: Clarification meeting
ClarificationMeeting.description: A clarification meeting is used to solve enquiries the tenderers may have about issues related to the call for proposals.

id.title: Meeting ID
id.description: A local identifier for this meeting, unique within this block.

date.title: Meeting date
date.description: The date on which the clarification meeting is held.

attendees.title: Clarification meeting attendees
attendees.description: The tenderers or other actors attending the clarification meeting.

officials.title: Clarification meeting officials
officials.description: The officials attending the clarification meeting.

RequestForQuotes.title: Request for quotes
RequestForQuotes.description: A request for quotes (RFQ) is a type of procurement solicitation in which a buyer asks invited suppliers to offer an estimated price for particular goods or services.

id.title: Request ID
id.description: A local identifier for this request, unique within this block.

description.title: Description
description.description: The text sent to the invited suppliers in order to participate in the quotation process.

period.title: Period to receive quotes
period.description: The period between the date when the request for quotes was made and the end date to receive the quotes.

items.title: Items to be quoted
items.description: The goods and services to be quoted, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but a quantity of 2 specified instead.

invitedSuppliers.title: Invited suppliers
invitedSuppliers.description: A list of invited suppliers asked to send quotes.

quotes.title: Quotes
quotes.description: A list of quotes received from invited suppliers.

Quote.title: Quote
Quote.description: A quote is a fixed price offered by a invited supplier for particular goods or services.

id.title: Quote ID
id.description: A local identifier for this quote, unique within this block.

description.title: Description
description.description: Quote description. Terms and conditions for the quote.

date.title: Quote date
date.description: The date of the quote. This is the date when the quote was received.

items.title: Items quoted
items.description: The goods and services quoted, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but a quantity of 2 specified instead.

value.title: Quote value
value.description: The total value of this quote.

period.title: Quote period
period.description: The period on which this quote is valid.

issuingSupplier.title: Issuing supplier
issuingSupplier.description: The supplier that sent a quote.

id.title: Obligation Id
id.description: Number of the document that represents the obligation.

description.title: Obligation Description
description.description: Describe the obligation.

bill.title: Bill
bill.description: The end date for the period. When known, a precise end date must always be provided.

creationDate.description: It indicates the date of loading of the obligation
creationDate.title: Creation Date

approvalDate.description: It indicates the date of verification and approval of the obligation by the hierarchical level.
approvalDate.title: Approval Date

id.title: Bill Id
id.description: It corresponds to the numbering of the document.

type.title: Bill Type
type.description: It corresponds to the description of the document class.

description.title: Bill Description
description.description: Brief description of the operation, referencing the documentations that support it.

date.description: Indicates the date of issue of the document.
date.title: Bill Date

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Indicates the amount of operation set forth in the document. (contains deductions)

Certificates.title: Certificates
Certificates.description: The certificate section is used to publish information about the certification, status, date and amount for a contracting process.

id.title: ID
id.description: An internal identifier for this item.

certificateAmount.title: Certificate Amount
certificateAmount.description: The current amount of the certification.

totalAmount.title: Total Amount
totalAmount.description: The total amount of the certification.

currentValue.title: Current Value
currentValue.description: The current value section is used to publish information about the different values of the contracting implementation.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency for each amount should always be specified using the uppercase 3-letter currency code from ISO4217.

openingValue.title: Opening Value
openingValue.description: The openingValue extension will be a field that will be added at planning.budget to show the value of the project adjusted to the opening date by a coefficient of inflation

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency for each amount should always be specified using the uppercase 3-letter currency code from ISO4217.

Progress.title: Progress
Progress.description: The progress section is used to publish information about the progress of a contracting process.

advancePercentage.title: Advance Percentage
advancePercentage.description: The progress percentage for the project.

actualValue.title: Value
actualValue.description: The current value of the contracting process.

investmentValue.title: Value
investmentValue.description: The invested value of the contracting process.

workDetailsStatus.title: Work Details Status
workDetailsStatus.description: The current global status of the contracting process, it can vary when the contract reach a new phase

id.title: ID
id.description: An internal identifier for this item.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the status

workDetailsType.title: Work Details Type
workDetailsType.description: The current global status of the contracting process

id.title: ID
id.description: An internal identifier for this item.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the status

WorkDetails.title: Work Details
WorkDetails.description: The work details section is used to publish information about the global status and type of management of the contracting process.

status.title: Status
status.description: Global status of a contracting process

type.title: Management type
type.description: Type of management for a contracting process

id.title: Obligation Id
id.description: Number of the document that represents the obligation.

description.title: Description
description.description: Brief description of the operation, referencing the documentations that support it.

bill.title: Bill
bill.description: The end date for the period. When known, a precise end date must always be provided.

creationDate.description: It indicates the date of loading of the obligation
creationDate.title: Creation Date

modificationDate.description: Indicates the date that is detected and corrected an error in the obligation.
modificationDate.title: Modification Date

cancellationDate.description: Indicates the date on which an obligation is left without effect for cause.
cancellationDate.title: Modification Date

approvalDate.description: It indicates the date of verification and approval of the obligation by the hierarchical level.
approvalDate.title: Approval Date

paymentRequestIds.title: Payment Request Ids
paymentRequestIds.description: Indicates the number of the payment request

id.title: Payment Request Id
id.description: It indicates the number of payment request

description.title: Description
description.description: It is a brief description in relation to the requested payment. It is loaded by the entities.

status.title: Status
status.description: Indicates the status of the payment request

creationDate.description: It indicates the date of loading of the payment request
creationDate.title: Creation Date

modificationDate.description: Indicates the date that is detected and corrected an error in the payment request.
modificationDate.title: Modification Date

treasuryReceptionDate.description: Indicates the date that the STR was received in the General direction of the Treasury
treasuryReceptionDate.title: Treasury Reception Date

authorizationDate.description: Authorization Date of the payment request
authorizationDate.title: Authorization Date

finantialObligationIds.title: Finantial Obligation Ids
finantialObligationIds.description: Listing numbers of obligations which are related to the payment request.

totalRetentionAmount.title: Total Retention Amount
totalRetentionAmount.description: Amounts of deductions (E.g.. Withholding of taxes, guarantee agreement, fines, etc.)

deductionAmountFromContract.title: Deduction amount from the contract
deductionAmountFromContract.description: Deduction amount from the contract due to causes of prohibitions

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of this deduction

expectedNumberOfTransactions.title: Expected number of transactions
expectedNumberOfTransactions.description: The total number of transactions expected from the contract

SimpleIdentifier.title: Simple identifier
SimpleIdentifier.description: An unambiguous reference to a resource within a given context.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The list, register or system from which the identifier is taken.

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier taken from the scheme.

awardCriteria.title: Award criteria
awardCriteria.description: Information about the award criteria for the lot.

id.title: Lot group identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this group of lots.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: Identifiers for this lot group. This field can be used to provide internal identifiers for the lot group, such as identifiers from a buyer's document management system or procurement system.

title.title: Title
title.description: A title for this lot group.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this lot group.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: A list of the identifiers of the lots that form this group. Lots can appear in more than one group.

optionToCombine.title: Option to combine
optionToCombine.description: The buyer reserves the right to combine the lots in this group when awarding a contract.

maximumValue.title: Maximum value
maximumValue.description: The maximum estimated value of the lots in this group. This can be lower than the sum total of lot values

suitability.title: Suitability
suitability.description: Information about the suitability of the lot group to different types of tenderers.

techniques.title: Techniques
techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

LotGroup.title: Lot group
LotGroup.description: Where the buyer reserves the right to combine lots, or wishes to specify the total value for a group of lots, a lot group is used to capture this information.

weightingDescription.title: Complicated weighting description
weightingDescription.description: When the weighting cannot be expressed per criterion, the mathematical equation (or other description) that expresses the complicated (e.g. non-linear) weighting.

orderRationale.title: Justification for order of importance
orderRationale.description: The justification for only indicating the award criteria's order of importance, not their weighting.

type.title: Type
type.description: The aspect of the bid that the criterion concerns.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the criterion.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the criterion.

CriterionNumber.title: Criterion number
CriterionNumber.description: Information about a number linked to a criterion.

weight.title: Weight
weight.description: Whether the number is a type of weight.

fixed.title: Fixed
fixed.description: Whether the number is a fixed value.

threshold.title: Threshold
threshold.description: Whether the number is a type of threshold.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier for the person.

name.title: Name
name.description: The full name of the person.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: An official identifier for the person. The scheme should follow the pattern {JURISDICTION}-{TYPE}, where JURISDICTION is a three-letter, uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code, and TYPE is one of "PASSPORT", "TAXID" or "IDCARD".

nationalities.title: Nationalities
nationalities.description: The nationalities of the person, from the closed country codelist.

email.title: Email
email.description: The e-mail address of the person.

faxNumber.title: Fax number
